src: Maak seker jou hand is so ontspanne as moontlik terwyl jy steeds al die korrekte note raak – probeer ook om nie baie vreemde bewegings met jou vingers te maak nie. Op daardie manier maak jy jouself so min as moontlik moeg. Onthou dat dit nie nodig is om die klawers met baie krag te tref vir ekstra volume soos vir die klavier nie. Op die trekklavier, gebruik jy die blaasbalk met meer krag of spoed,om ekstra volume te kry.
mt: Make sure your hands are as relaxed as possible while you still hit all the right notes – try not to make too many strange movements with your fingers. This way you make yourself as little tired as possible. Remember that it is not necessary to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume as for the piano. On the drawbar organ, you use the blowbar with more force or speed, to get extra volume.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Een van die mees algemeenste probleme wanneer ‘n fliek na DVD-formaat omgeskakel word is die “overscan”. Meeste televisies word gemaak om die algemene publiek tevrede te stel. Vir daardie rede, als wat jy op die TV sien, het die kante gesny, bo, onder en kante. Dit word gemaak om te verseker dat die beeld die hele skerm dek. Dit word oorskandering genoem. Ongelukking sal die kante waarskynlik af gesny word wanneer jy ‘n DVD maak, en indien die video onderskrifte te naby aan die onderkant het, sal dit nie ten volle vertoon word nie.
mt: One of the most common problems when a movie is converted to DVD format is the "overscan". Most televisions are made to satisfy the general public. For that reason, what you see on the TV has the edges trimmed, top, bottom and sides. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. This is called overscan. Disappointment will likely have the edges trimmed when you make a DVD, and if the video subtitles are too close to the bottom, they will not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Die Amerikaanse plan het hoofsaaklik gesteun daarop om gekoördineerde aanvalle uit drie verskillende rigtings te loods. Generaal John Cadwalder sou ‘n afleidings-aanval teen die Britse garnisoen in Bordentown loods om enige versterkings te blokkeer. Generaal James Ewing sou 700 manskappe oor die rivier by Trenton Ferry neem, die brug oor die Assunpink Spruit in besit neem en enige vyandelike troepe se ontsnapping in die wiele ry. Die hoof aanvalsmag van 2 400 manskappe sou oor die rivier gaan nege myl noord van Trenton, en dan in twee groepe opdeel, een onder aanvoerding van Green, en 'n ander onder Sullivan, sodat 'n aanval voor sonsopkoms geloods sou kon word.
mt: The American plan had primarily relied on coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would lead a diversion attack against the British garrison in Bordentown to block any reinforcements. General James Ewing would ferry 700 men across the river at Trenton Ferry, take possession of the bridge over the Assunpink Creek, and block any enemy troops from escaping. The main attack force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under the command of Green, and the other under Sullivan, so that an attack could be launched before sunrise.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Na die aanneeming deur Kongres op Julie 4, ‘n handgeskrewe konsep geteken deur die President van Kongres John Hancock en die Sekretaris Charles Thomson was toe ‘n paar bloke weg gestuur na die drukkery van John Dunlap. Deur die nag, is tussen 150 en 200 kopieë gemaak, wat nou as “Dunlap broadsides” bekend staan. Die eerste publieke lesing van die dokument was deur John Nixon op die werf van die Onafhanklikheidsaal op July 8. Een is gestuur na George Washington op 6 Julie, wat dit op 9 Julie in New York aan sy troepe laat lees het. ‘n Kopie het London op die 10de Augustus bereik. Die 25 Dunlap swepe wat nog bestaan staan bekend as die oudste kopieë van die dokument wat nog bestaan. Die oorspronklike handgeskrewe kopie het nie oorleef nie.
mt: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few guys to the printing press of John Dunlap. By night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, which now are known as “Dunlap broadsides”. The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon on the lawn of the Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who read it to his troops on July 9 in New York. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap sweeps that still exist are known as the oldest copies of the document that still exist. The original handwritten copy did not survive.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Die koloniste het gevra vir versterkings toe hulle die aktiwiteite sien. Troepe wat die voorwaartse posisie versterk sluit die 1ste en 3de New Hampshire regiment van 200 mans in, onder Kollonelle John Stark en James Reed (beide het later generals geword). Stark se manne het posisies langs die heining ingeneem aan die noordekant van die Koloniste se posisie. Wanneer ‘n lae gety ‘n groot gaping langs die Mistiese Rivier oopgemaak het, langs die noordooste van die skiereiland, het hulle vinnig die draad verleng met ‘n kort klipmuur aan die noorde naby die water se rant op ‘n klein strandjie. Gridley of Stark het 'n spel ongeveer 100 voet (30 m) voor die heining geplaas en beveel dat niemand skiet voordat die gereelde mense verbygegaan het nie.
mt: The colonists asked for reinforcements when they saw the activity. Troops who strengthened the forward position included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men under Colonel John Stark and James Reed (both later generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence to the north of the Colonists' position. When a low tide opened a large gap along the Mystic River to the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the line with a short stone wall to the north near the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a picket about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one shoot until the regulars had passed by.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Antieke China het ‘n unieke manier gehad om verskillende tydsperiodes te wys; elke stadium van China of elke familie wat in beheer was, was ‘n afsonderlike dinastie. Daar was ook tussen elke dinastie ‘n onstabiele tydperk van verdeelde provinsies. Die mees-bekende van hierdie periodes van die Three Kingdoms tydperk wat plaasgevind het in die 60 jaar tussen die Han en die Jin Dinastie. Gedurende hierdie periodes was daar erge oorlogvoering tussen baie adellikes wat geveg het vir die troon. Die Drie Koninkryke was een van die bloedigste tydperke in Antieke Chinese geskiedenis; met duisende mense wat gesterf het in die stryd om op die hoogste sitplek in die grootse paleis in Xi'an te sit.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in control was a separate dynasty. There was also between each dynasty an unstable period of divided provinces. The most famous of these periods of the Three Kingdoms period that took place in the 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods there was fierce warfare between many nobles who fought for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in Ancient Chinese history; with thousands of people dying in the struggle to sit on the highest seat in the largest palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Weermagmier’ mars en maak nes in verskillende formasies. In die nomadiese fase marsjeer swerfmiere snags en stop hulle om te kamp tydens die dag. Die kolonie het ‘n nomadiese fase begin toe beskikbare kos afgeneem het. Gedurende hierdie fase, het die kolonie tydelike neste gemaak wat elke dag verander is. Elkeen van die nomadiese optogte duur vir ongeveerd 17 dae.
mt: Army ants march and make nests in various formations. In the nomadic phase, wandering swarms march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony began its nomadic phase when available food decreased. During this phase, the colony made temporary nests that changed daily. Each of the nomadic marches lasted for about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Baie het ritmes in fisiologie waargeneem en gedrag is dikwels uiters afhanklik van die teenwoordigheid van endogene siklusse en hul produksie deur biologiese klokke. Periodieke ritmes, wat nie net reaksies op eksterne periodieke seine is nie, is vir die meeste lewende wesens opgeteken, insluitende bakterieë, swamme, plante en diere. Biologiese klokke is selfonderhoudende ossilators wat ‘n periode van vry-lopende siklusse sal aanhou, self in die afwesigheid van eksterne aanleiding.
mt: Many have observed rhythms in physiology and behavior is often very dependent on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production by biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not just reactions to external periodic signals, have been recorded for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue a period of free-running cycles, even in the absence of external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: ‘n Populasie is ‘n versameling van organismes van ‘n spesifieke spesie binne ‘n gegewe geografiese area. Wanneer alle individue in ‘n populasie identies is so ver as ‘n spesifieke fenotipiese kenmerk dan is hulle bekend as monomorfies. Wanneer die individue verskeie variante van ‘n sekere eienskap toon is hulle polimorfies.
mt: A population is a collection of organisms of a specific species within a given geographical area. When all individuals in a population are identical as far as a specific phenotypic trait is concerned, they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals exhibit different variants of a certain trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Natuurgebaseerde toerisme trek mense wat belangstel daarin om natuurlike areas te besoek met die doel om die omgewing te geniet, insluitend die plant en diere lewe. Voorbeelde van aktiwiteite op die perseel sluit jag, visvang, fotografie, voëlkyk en besoekparke en studies van informasie oor die ekosisteem, in. ‘n Voorbeeld is om Borneo te besoek en te leer van oerangoetangs en hul te fotografeer.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people who are interested in visiting natural areas with the goal of enjoying the environment, including the plant and animal life. Examples of activities on the premises include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem, among others. An example is to visit Borneo and learn about orangutans and photograph them.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Elke oggend verlaat mense die klein dorpies in karre om na hul werkplekke te gaan en word deur ander verbygegaan wie se werkplek die area is waarvandaan hulle sopas weggetrek het. In hierdie dinamiese pendeltuig is almal op een of ander manier verbind met en ondersteun 'n vervoerstelsel gebaseer op privaat motors. Die wetenskap wys daarop dat hierdie massiewe koolstof-ekonomie die biosfeer se stabiele toestande aangetas het wat menslike evolusie vir die laaste twee miljoen jaar ondersteun het.
mt: Every morning people leave the small villages in cars to go to their workplaces and are passed by others who's workplace is the area from where they just moved away. In this dynamic commute everyone is in one way or another connected to and supporting a transport system based on private cars. Science shows that this massive carbon economy has tipped the biosphere's stable conditions that human evolution has supported for the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Die atoom kan as een van die fundamentele boustene van alle materie gereken word. Dit is ‘n baie komplekse entiteit wat, volgens ‘n vereenvoudige Bohr model, uit ‘n sentrale kern bestaan wat deur elektrone omring word, ietwat soortgelyk aan planete wat om die son wentel – sien Figuur 1.1. Die nukleus bestaan uit twee deeltjies - neutrone en protone. Protone het ‘n positiewe elektroniese lading terwyl neutrone geen lading het nie. Die elektrone het ‘n negatiewe elektroniese lading.
mt: The atom can be considered one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex entity that, according to a simplified Bohr model, consists of a central nucleus surrounded by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electronic charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electronic charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Byna alle rekenaars wat vandag in gebruik is, is gebaseerd op die manipulasie van informasie wat gekodeer is in die vorm van binêre nommers. ‘n Binêre nommer kan slegs een van twee waardes hê, d.i. 0 of 1, en daar word na hierdie nommers verwys as binêre getalle - of bits, om rekenaarterminologie te gebruik.
mt: 99.9% of the computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can only have one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits or bits, using computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Webjoernale kan ook help om studente se skryf-vermoë te verbeter. Terwyl studente gereëld hul webjoernaal ondervinding begin met morsige taalgebruik en spelling, verander die teenwoordigheid van waarnemers dit gewoonlik. Aangesien studente dikwels die mees kritiese gehoor is, begin die webjoernaalskrywer verbeterde skryfwerk nastreef om kritiek te vermy. Blogging “forseer student om meer vaardig te word oor die wêreld rondom hulle.) Die noodigheid om die belangstelling van die skare te voed inspirer studente om slim en interressant te wees (Toto, 2004). Blog is 'n gereedskap wat samewerking inspireer en studente aanmoedig om leer ver verby die tradisionele skooldag te neem. Toepaslike gebruik van blogs kan studente bemagtig om meer analities en krities te word; deur aktief op internetmateriale te reageer, kan studente hul posisies definieer in die konteks van ander se geskrifte, asook om hul eie perspektiewe op bepaalde kessies (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Weblogs can also help improve students' writing skills. While students begin their weblogging experience with sloppy language use and spelling, the presence of observers usually changes that. As students are often the most critical audience, the weblogger begins to improve his or her writing to avoid criticism. Blogging “forces students to become more adept at the world around them.) The need to feed the audience's interest inspires students to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blog is a tool that inspires collaboration and encourages students to learn beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs can empower students to be more analytical and critical; by actively reacting to online materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings, as well as their own perspectives on certain issues (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asynchrone kommunikasie moedig tyd vir besinning en reaksies teenoor ander aan. Dit laat studente toe om teen hul eie pas te werk en die tempo van instruksionele inligting te beheer. Boonop, daar is minder tydsbeperkinge met die moontlikheid van buigbare werksure. (Bremer, 1998) Die gebruik van die Internet en die Wêreld Wye Web laat leerders toe om toegang tot inligting ten alle tye te hê. Studente kan ook vrae rig aan instrukteurs ten enige tyd van die dag en redelike goeie response verwag, eerder as om te wag tot hul volgende ontmoeting van aangesig tot aangesig.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reactions to others. It allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. Furthermore, there are fewer time constraints with the possibility of flexible work hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at any time. Students can also pose questions to instructors at any time of the day and reasonable good responses are expected, rather than waiting until their next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Tradisionele middeleeuse kastele het vir lank mense se verbeelding geïnspireer met beelde van steekspele, feesmaaltye en Arthuriaanse ridderlikheid. Deur te staan tussen die duisend jare oue ruïnes is dit maklik om jou die geluide en reuke van veldslae van jare gelede te verbeel, om amper die gekletter van hoewe op die keistene te hoor en die vrees te ruik wat uit die kerker putte opreis. Maar is ons verbeelding gebaseer op realiteit? Hoekom is kastele in die eerste plek opgerig? Hoe is hulle ontwerp en gebou?
mt: Traditional medieval castles have long inspired people's imaginations with images of jousting, feasts and Arthurian chivalry. Standing between the thousand-year-old ruins, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of battles of yore, almost hearing the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and smelling the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Tipies van die tydperk is Kirby Muxloe Kasteel meer van 'n versterkte huis as 'n ware kasteel. Die groot geglaseerde vensters en dun mure sou nie in staat wees om die aanval vir lank te weerstaan nie. Toe Lord Hasting die konstruksie in die 1480’s begin het, was die land relatief verdevol en die enigste beskerming wat nodig was, was teen klein groepies rondreisende rowers.
mt: Typical of the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle was more of a fortified house than a true castle. The large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to withstand an attack for long. When Lord Hastings began construction in the 1480’s, the country was relatively peaceful and the only protection needed was against small groups of roving rowers.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Met die verandering van die kwart na die halfmyl wedloop, word spoed minder belangrik, en uithou vermoë word ‘n absolute noodsaaklikheid. Natuurlik is hy ‘n eersteklas half-myler, ‘n man wat twee minute kan klop, en oor ‘n billike hoeveelheid spoed beskik, maar moet oor uithouvermoë beskik wat onder alle toestande gekultiveer is. Sommige landloop wedlope gedurende die winter, gekombineer met gimnasium werk vir jou bolyf, is die beste voorbereiding vir die hardloop seisoen.
mt: As the race moves into the final quarter mile, speed becomes less important, and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course, he is a first-class quarter-miler, a man who can run two minutes flat, and has a fair amount of speed, but he must have endurance that has been cultivated under all conditions. Some track meets are held in the winter, combined with gymnasium work for your body, is the best preparation for the running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Behoorlike voedingspraktyke alleen kan nie keur optredes tot gevolg hê nie, maar hulle kan jong atlete se algehele welstand merkwaardig affekteer. Deur ‘n gesonde energiebalans te behou, effektiewe hidrasiegewoontes te beoefen en die verskillende aspekte van aanvullingspraktyke te verstaan, kan atlete help om hulle produktiwiteit en genot van die sport te verbeter.
mt: Appropriate nutrition practices alone cannot lead to peak performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes’ overall well-being. By maintaining a healthy energy balance, effective hydration habits, and understanding the different aspects of supplementation practices, athletes can help improve their productivity and enjoyment of the sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Middel-afstand hardloop is ‘n relatiewe goedkoop sport; alhoewel, daar is baie misvattings rakende die paar dele toerusting wat benodig word om deel te neem. Produkte kan gekoop word soos benodig, maar die meeste sal geen of min ware impak op optrede hê nie. Atlete mag voel dat hulle 'n produk verkies, selfs wanneer dit geen ware voordele bied nie.
mt: Middle-distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; although, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment needed to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have no or little real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product, even when it offers no real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRB word gebaseer op ‘n wetenskaplike verskynsel genaamd kern magnetiese resonansie (KMR), wat in die 1930s deur Felix Bloch (werkend by Stanford Universiteit) en Edward Purcell (van Harvard Universiteit) ontdek is. In hierdie resonansie veroorsaak die magnetiese veld en radiogolwe dat atome klein radioseine afgee. In die jaar 1970 het Raymond Damadian, ‘n mediese dokter en navorsings wetenskaplike die basis vir die gebruik van magnetiese resonansie uitbeelding as gereedskap vir mediese diagnose. Vier jaar later is 'n patent toegeken, wat die wêreld se eerste patent was wat op die MRB veld toegeken is. In 1977, het Dr. Damadian konstruksie aan die eerste “vol-liggaam” MRI skandeerder voltooi, wat hy die “Ontembare” genoem het.
mt: MRB is based on a scientific phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University). In this resonance, the magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit small radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, laid the basis for the use of magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the MRB field. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed construction of the first "whole-body" MRI scanner, which he called the "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Mense is by verre die mees talentvolle spesie met die lees van ander se gedagtes. Dit beteken dat ons met sukses kan voorspel wat ander mense sien, plan, glo, weet of begeer. Onder hierdie vaardighede, is dit belangrik om die bedoeling van andere te verstaan. Dit laat ons toe om moontlike dubbelsinnighede van fisiese aksies op te los. Byvoorbeeld, indien jy sien hoe iemand ‘n kar se venster breek, sal jy seker aanneem dat hy besig was om ‘n vreemdeling se motor te probeer steel. Hy sou anders geoordeel moes word as hy sy kar sleutels verloor het en dit sy eie kar was waarin hy probeer inbreek het.
mt: People are by far the most talented species at reading the minds of others. This means that we can successfully predict what others see, plan, believe, know, or desire. Among these abilities, it is important to understand the intentions of others. This allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you see someone break a car's window, you would certainly assume that he was trying to steal a stranger's car. He would be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and was trying to break into his own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Alhoewel Al ‘n sterk konnotasie met wetenskapsfiksie het, vorm Al ‘n baie belangrike tak van rekenaar wetenskap, wat met gedrag, leer en intelligente aanpassing in ‘n masjien te doen hê. Navorsing in AI behels masjiene maak om take te automatiseer wat intelligente gedrag benodig. Voorbeelde sluit in beheer, beplanning en skedulering, die vermoë om kliënt diagnoses en vraë te antwoord asook handskrif erkenning, stem en gesig. Sulke dinge het afsonderlike dissiplines geword, wat fokus daarop om oplossings te bied op regte lewensprobleme. Die AI sisteen is nou gereeld gebruik in die velde van ekonomie, medisyne, ingeneurswese en die militêre eenhede, en is ook ingebou in verskeie tuisrekenaars en videospeletjie sagteware toepassings.
mt: While Al has a strong connotation with science fiction, Al is a very important branch of computer science, which deals with behavior, learning and adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves machines making to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer client diagnoses and questions as well as handwriting recognition, speech and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI system is now regularly used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military units, and is also built into several home computers and video game software applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Alhoewel Al ‘n sterk konnotasie met wetenskapsfiksie het, vorm Al ‘n baie belangrike tak van rekenaar wetenskap, wat met gedrag, leer en intelligente aanpassing in ‘n masjien te doen hê. Navorsing in AI behels masjiene maak om take te automatiseer wat intelligente gedrag benodig. Voorbeelde sluit in beheer, beplanning en skedulering, die vermoë om kliënt diagnoses en vraë te antwoord asook handskrif erkenning, stem en gesig. Sulke dinge het afsonderlike dissiplines geword, wat fokus daarop om oplossings te bied op regte lewensprobleme. Die AI sisteen is nou gereeld gebruik in die velde van ekonomie, medisyne, ingeneurswese en die militêre eenhede, en is ook ingebou in verskeie tuisrekenaars en videospeletjie sagteware toepassings.
mt: While Al has a strong connotation with science fiction, Al is a very important branch of computer science, which deals with behavior, learning and adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves machines making to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer client diagnoses and questions as well as handwriting recognition, speech and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI system is now regularly used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military units, and is also built into several home computers and video game software applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Samevloeiende denkpatrone is probleemoplossingstegnieke wat verskillende idees oor velde verenig om 'n oplossing te vind. Die fokus van hierdie denkwyse is spoed, logika en akkuraatheid, ook die identifikasie van feite, die hertoepassing van bestaande tegnieke, en die insameling van inligting. Die mees belangrike faktor van hierdie denkwyse is: daar is slegs een korrekte antwoord. Jy dink slegs aan twee antwoorde, naamlik reg of verkeerd. Hierdie tipe van denkwyse word met sekere wetenskap of standaard prosedures geassosieer. Mense met hierdie tipe van denksswyse het ‘n logiese denkpatroon, is in staat om patrone te memoriseer, probleme op te los en op wetenskaplike toetse te werk.
mt: Convergent thinking is problem-solving techniques that bring together different ideas across fields to find a solution. The focus of these approaches is speed, logic and accuracy, also the identification of facts, the reapplication of existing techniques, and the collection of information. The most important factor of these approaches is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have a logical thinking pattern, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Die gebruik van video opname het gelei na belangrike ontdekkings in die interpretasies van mikro-uitdrukkings, gesigs bewegings wat ‘n paar millisekondes hou. In besonder word dit gemeld dit dat 'n mens kan optel wanneer 'n persoon lieg deur die mikro-uitdrukkings korrek te interpreteer. Oliver Sacks het in sy dokument, Die President se Toespraak, aangedui hoe mense wat nie in staat was om die toespraak te verstaan vanweë breinskade nie, nogtans daartoe in staat was om opregtheid akkuraat te skat. Hy het selfs voorgestel dat sulke vermoëns om menslike gedrag te interpreter gedeel word deur diere soos huishoudelike honde.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the interpretations of micro-expressions, facial movements that last a few milliseconds. In particular it is reported that one can tell when a person is lying by correctly interpreting the micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks has in his document, The President's Speech, indicated how people who were unable to understand the speech due to brain damage were nevertheless able to accurately gauge sincerity. He even suggested that such abilities to interpret human behavior are shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Soos die vermoë om kennis te bekom en te leer verander het op so ‘n manier as wat hierbo genoem is, het die basiese tempo waarteen kennis opgedoen is, ook verander. Die benadering tot die verkryging van inligting was anders. Druk het nie meer binne individuele herroeping gebly nie, maar die vermoë om teks te herroep het meer van ‘n focus geword. In wese het die Renaissance ‘n groot verandering gemaak in die benadering tot die leer en verspreiding van kennis.
mt: As the ability to acquire and learn has changed in the way described above, the basic rate at which knowledge is acquired has also changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. Print no longer remained within individual recollection, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a great change in the approach to learning and spreading of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Die internet kombineer elemente van beide massa en interpersoonlike kommunikasie. Die kenmerkende karaktertrekke van die Internet lei tot addisionele dimensies in terme van die gebruike en belonings benadering. Byvoorbeeld, “leer” en “sosialiseer” word voorgestel as belangrike motiverings vir Internetgebruik ( James et al., 1995). “Toe Eighmey en McCord (1998) gehoor reaksies op webtuistes ondersoek het, het hul “Persoonlike betrokkenheid” en “voortgesette verhoudings” geïdentifiseer as nuwe motiverings aspekte.
mt: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The characteristic features of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learn” and “socialize” are proposed as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “When Eighmey and McCord (1998) examined responses to web sites, they identified “personal involvement” and “continued relationships” as new motivational aspects.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Die Gotiese styl het sy piek bereik tussen die 10e en 11de eeue en in die 14e eeu. Die drag is aan die begin sterk beïnvloed deur die Bisantynse kultuur in die ooste. Weens die stadige kommunikasie kanale, kan style in die wes teen 25 tot 30 per jaar agterbly. nader aan die einde van die Middeleeue het wes-Europa hul eie styl begin ontwikkel. Een van die grootste ontwikkelings van die tyd was as gevolg van die kruistogte wat mense begin het om knope te gebruik om klere mee vas te maak.
mt: The Gothic style reached its peak between the 10th and 11th centuries and in the 14th century. The style was initially strongly influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. Due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. Near the end of the Middle Ages, western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest developments of the time was due to the Crusades that people began to use buttons to fasten clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Ons kan vriendeliker begin lewe teenoor die omgewing, ons kan by die omgewingsbeweging aansluit, en ons kan selfs aktiviste word om die toekomstige lyding tot ‘n mate te bekamp. Dis nes die simptomatiese behandeling in vele gevalle. Hoe dit okal sy, indien ons nie slegs ‘n tydelike oplossing soek nie, dan behoort ons die wortel van die probleme te vind, en ons moet hulle onskadelik stel. Dit is duidelik genoeg dat die wêreld baie verander het as gevolg van die mensdom se wetenskaplike en tegnologiese vooruitgang, en probleme het groter geword as gevolg van oor-populasie en die mensdom se buitensporige leefstyl.
mt: We can start living more kindly towards the environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even become activists to combat the future suffering to some extent. This is like symptomatic treatment in many cases. How it goes, if we are not just looking for a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should neutralize them. It is clear enough that the world has changed a lot due to the human race’s scientific and technological progress, and problems have grown bigger due to overpopulation and the human race’s excessive lifestyle.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Die magsbalans was ‘n sisteem waarin Europese nasies gepoog het om die nasionale soewereiniteit van alle Europese state te behou. Die konsep was dat alle Europese lande moes poog om te voorkom dat een volk meer mag oor die ander moet het, daarom het nasionale regerings dikwels hul alliansies verander om die balans te handhaaf Die Oorlog van die Spaanse Opvolging merk die eerste oorlog wat se sentrale punt die magsbalans was. Hierdie merk ‘n belangrike verandering, aangesien Europese magte nie meer die voorwendsel van gelooofs-oorloë kan voorhou nie. Daarom sal die Dertig Jaar Oorlog as die laaste Geloofs-oorlog bestempel word.
mt: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to preserve the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European states should seek to prevent one people from having more power over the others, so national governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession marks the first war whose central point was the balance of power. This marks an important change, since European powers could no longer hide behind the pretext of religious wars. Therefore, the Thirty Years War will be the last Religious War.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Tydens hierdie periode van Europese geskiedenis, is die Katolieke Kerk, wat ryk en magtig geword het, onder die soeklig geplaas. Vir meer as ‘n duisend jaar het die Christelike geloof Europese state saamgebind ten spyte van taal- en kultuurverskille. Die alles-deurdringende krag daarvan het elkeen geaffekteer; van die koning tot die gemeenskapslede. Een van die hoof Christen beginsels is dat rykdom gebruik moet word om lyding en armoede te verlig en dat die geldelike vonds van die kerk spesifiek vir hierdie rede daar is. Vir meer as ‘n duisend jaar is die sentrale gesag van die kerk in Rome, en hierdie konsentrasie van mag en geld het gelei dat baie hierdie uitgangspunt bevraagteken.
mt: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, was placed under the spotlight. For more than a thousand years, the Christian faith had bound together European states despite language and cultural differences. Its all-pervasive power had affected everyone, from the king to the community members. One of the main Christian principles is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the church’s financial resources are specifically for this reason. For more than a thousand years, the central authority of the church was in Rome, and this concentration of power and money led many to question this principle.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Die vreesbevange Koning Louis XVI, Koningin Marie Antoinette, hul twee jong kinders (11-jarige Marie Therese en vier-jaarige Louis-Charles) en die Koning se suster, Madam Elizabeth, is op die 6de Oktober 1789 gedwing om terug Parys toe te vlug van Versailles af, deur ‘n skare markvroue. In ‘n wa, het hulle terug gereis na Parys terwyl hulle omsingel was deur ‘n skare mense wat roep en dreigemente skree teen die Koning en Koningin. Die menigte mense het die koning en koningin geforseer om hul koets se vensters wyd oop te maak. Op een punt het ‘n lid van die betogers die kop van ‘n koninklike wat by Versailles doodgemaak is voor die vreesbevange Koningin rondgeswaai.
mt: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (11-year-old Marie Therese and four-year-old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles on October 6, 1789, by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they returned to Paris while they were surrounded by a mob of people who shouted and threatened the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the king and queen to open the windows of their carriage wide. At one point, a member of the protesters waved the head of a royal who was killed at Versailles before the terrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Kort na die uitbraak van onluste het Britanje ‘n vlootblokkade van Duitsland inisieër. Die strategie is effektief bewys; dit het lewensbelangrike militêre en siviele voorrade afgesny, al het die blokkade algemeen aanvaarde internasionale wette deur verskeie internasionale ooreenkomste van die laaste twee eeue verbreek. Brittanje het gemyn in internasionale waters om enige skepe te verhoed om groot dele van die oseaan in te gaan, wat gevaar sou beteken selfs vir neutrale skepe. Sedert daar beperkte reaksie op hierdie tactic was, het Duitsland ‘n soortgelyke reaksie om sy onbeperkte duikboot oorlogvoering verwag.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain imposed a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy was proven effective; it cut off vital military and civilian supplies, although the blockade generally accepted international laws by breaking several international treaties of the last two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering large parts of the ocean, which would have been dangerous even for neutral ships. Since there was limited reaction to this tactic, Germany expected a similar reaction to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Regoor die Verenigde State van Amerika, is daar ongeveer 400,000 gevalle van Veelvuldige Sklerose (MS), wat dit die grootste neurologiese siekte in jonger en middeljarige ouderdom volwassenes maak. MS is ‘n siekte wat die sentrale senuwee stelsel affekteer, wat insluit, die brein, die ruggraat en die optiese senuwee. Navorsing vind dat vrouens dubbeld so waarskynlik is om MS te kry as mans.
mt: 400,000 cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) in the United States, making it the largest neurological disease in younger and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research shows that women are twice as likely to get MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Die studie het gevind dat depressie, vrees en katastrofering die verhouding tussen pyn en gestremdheid in lae-rug lyers bemiddel. Sleg die gevolge van oordrewing, nie depressie of vrees, was die kondisie van weeklikse gestruktueerde PA sessies. Die wat deelneem aan gereelde aktiwiteit vereis meer ondersteuning in terme van negatiewe persepsie van pyn en onderskeiding van verskille van chroniese pyn en ongemak teenoor normale fisiese beweging.
mt: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophizing mediate the relationship between pain and disability in low-back sufferers. Poor the consequences of overexertion, not depression or fear, were the condition of weekly structured PA sessions. Those who participate in regular activity require more support in terms of negative perception of pain and differentiation of differences of chronic pain and discomfort versus normal physical activity.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Die moderne omheiningsport word op baie vlakke gespeel, van Universiteit studente wat leer, tot professionele en Olimpiese kompetisie. Die sport word hoofsaaklik in 'n tweestrydformaat gespeel, waarvan die een skermer 'n ander uitoorlê/uitdaag.
mt: The modern fencing sport is played on many levels, from university students who learn, to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is mainly played in a two-person format, where one fencer challenges another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Interne vergifting mag nie onmiddellik ooglopend wees nie. Simptome soos braking is algemeen genoeg dat 'n onmiddellike diagnose nie gemaak kan word nie. Die beste aanduiding van interne vergiftiging mag die aanwesigheid van ‘n oop houer medikasie of huishoudelike chemikalieë wees. Kyk na die etiket vir spesifieke eerstehulp instruksies vir daardie spesifieke gif.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately obvious. Symptoms such as vomiting are common enough that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or household chemicals. Look at the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Om die slagoffer na te gaan, moet jy eers ‘n opname van die toneel neem, om jou veiligheid te verseker. Jy moet die slagoffer se posisie en enige outomatiese rooi vlaggies opmerk soos jy hom of haar nader. Indien jy seerkry terwyl jy probeer help, mag jy dalk net dinge vererger.
mt: To assess the victim, you must first take a picture of the scene to ensure your safety. You must note the victim's position and any automatic red flags as you approach him or her. If you are injured while trying to help, you may only make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Daar is baie sosiale en politieke effekte, soos die gebruik van die metrieke sisteem, ‘n verskuiwing van absolutisme na republikanisme, nasionalisme en die geloof dat die land behoort aan die mense en nie aan een alleenheerser nie. Na die Rewolusie was beroepe ook oop aan manlike aansoekers wat die mees ambiseuse en suksesvol toegelaat het om te slaag. Dieselfe geld vir die weermag, aangesien die weermag range nou gebaseer is op kaliber, eerder as op klas. Die Franse Revolusie het ook baie ander onderdrukte werkersklas mense van ander lande inspireer om hulle eie rewolusies te begin.
mt: There are many social and political effects, such as the use of the metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the country belongs to the people and not to one sole ruler. After the Revolution, applications were also open to male applicants who were the most ambitious and successful to allow them to succeed. The same money for the army, since the army ranges are now based on caliber, rather than on class. The French Revolution also inspired many other oppressed working class people from other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Almal neem deel in die gemeenskap en gebruik die transportsisteme. Byna almal kla oor die transportsisteme. In ontwikkelde lande hoor jy selde soortgelyke vlakke van klagtes oor water-kwaliteit of brûe wat platval. Hoekom kweek vervoerstelsels sulke klagtes, hoekom faal dit op ‘n daaglikse basis? Is vervoer ingeneurs net onbevoeg? Of is iets meer fundamenteel aan die gang?
mt: Everyone participates in the transportation system. Nearly everyone complains about the transportation system. In developed countries you rarely hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges that collapse. Why does transportation create such complaints, why does it fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Verkeer Vloei is die studie van die beweging van individuele bestuurders en voertuie tussen twee punte en die interaksies wat hul met mekaar het. Ongelukkig is ‘n studie van verkeersvloei moeilik omdat bestuurdergedrag nie met eenhonderd persent sekerheid voorspel kan word nie. Gelukkig tree bestuurders op binne ‘n redelike konsekwente reeks; en aldus het verkeers-strome ‘n redelike konsekwentheid en kan dit rofweg wiskundig voorgestel word. Om verkeersvloei beter te verteenwoordig, is verhoudings bewerkstellig tussen die 3 hoof karaktertrekke: (1) vloei, (2) digtheid, en (3) snelheid. Hierdie verhoudings help in die beplanning, ontwerp en operasie van ryvlakfasiliteite.
mt: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they have with each other. Unfortunately, a study of traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers act within a reasonable consistent sequence; and thus, traffic streams have a reasonable consistency and can be roughly mathematically represented. To better represent traffic flow, relationships are established between the 3 main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and operation of roadway facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Die Hershey en Chase eksperiment was een van die hoofvoorstelle dat DNA genetiese materiaal is. Hershey en Chase het phages of virusse gebruik om hulle eie DNA in ‘n bakterie in te plant. Hulle het twee eksperimente uitgevoer wat óf die DNA in die faag met ‘n radioaktiewe-fosfor of die proteϊen van die faag met radioaktiewe swael gemerk het.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the main proposals that DNA is genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages or viruses to insert their own DNA into a bacterium. They performed two experiments that either marked the DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus or the proteins of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasies kan ‘n verskeidenheid van effekte hê afhangend van die tipe mutasie, die belangrikheid van die stuk genetiese materiaal geaffekteer, en of die selle wat geaffekteer is kiem-lyn selle is. Net mutasies in kiem-lyn selle kan oorgedra word na kinders, terwyl mutasies in ander plekke die dood van selle of kanker kan veroorsaak.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected piece of genetic material, and whether the affected cells are stem-line cells. Only mutations in stem-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations in other places can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Bokke is ongeveer 10,000 jaar gelede die eerste keer mak gemaak in die Zagros Berge van Iran. Antieke kulture en stamme het begin om hulle aan te hou vir maklike toegang tot melk, hare, vleis en velle. Gedomestikeerde bokke is algemeen in troppe gehou wat oor die heuwels en ander beweidingsgebiede gewandel het, en na omgesien is deur bokherders wat meermale kinders of tieners was , soortgelyk aan die meer alombekende skaapherders. Hierdie metodes van oppas word steeds vandag gebruik.
mt: Goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat and hides. Domesticated goats are commonly kept in herds that roamed over the hills and other grazing areas, and were tended by goat herders who were often children or teenagers, similar to the more well known sheep herders. These methods of tending are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Gholf is ’n spel waarin spelers kolwe gebruik om balle in gate in te slaan. Agtien putjies word gedurende ‘n normale rondte gespeel, met spelers wat met die eerste gaatjie op die baan begin en eindig op die agtiende. Die speler wat die minste slae, of kolfskote neem, en die baan klaar maak, wen. Die spel word op gras gespeel, en die gras kan naby die gaatjie korter gesny word, en word dit die gholfgroen genoem.
mt: Golf is a sport in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes in the ground. Eighteen holes are played during a normal round, with players starting and ending on the first hole. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or golf shots, and completes the course, wins. The sport is played on grass, and the grass can be cut shorter near the hole, and is called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Wetenskap se hoofdoel is om uit te vind hoe die wêreld werk deur ‘n wetenskaplike metode. Hierdie metode begelei feitelik meeste wetenskaplike navorsing. Alhoewel dit nie aleen is nie, eksperimentasie, en ‘n eksperiment in ‘n toets wat gebruik word om een of meer moontlike hipoteses te elimineer, vrae te vra, en observasies te neem ook wetenskaplike navorsing rig.
mt: The main goal of science is to find out how the world works by a scientific method. This method guides most scientific research. Although it is not the only one, experimentation, and an experiment in a test that is used to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses, ask questions, and take observations also scientific research rigorous.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadoes tref klein areas in vergelyking met ander geweldadige storms, maar hul kan alles in hul pad vernietig. Tornados ontwortel bome, ruk borde van geboue, en gooi karre op in die lug in. Die mees gewelddadige twee persent tornadoes duur meer as drie ure. Sulke monster storms het winde van tot 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes strike small areas in comparison to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornados uproot trees, rip roofs off buildings, and toss cars into the air. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. Such monster storms have winds of up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Mense maak en gebruik al vir duisende en duisende jare lense vir vergroting. Die eerste ware teleskope is egter in Europa in die laat 16de eeu gemaak. Daardie teleskope het ‘n kombinasie van twee lense gebruik om ver voorwerpe beide nader en groter te laat voorkom.
mt: People have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. The first true telescopes, however, were made in Europe in the late 16th century. Those telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects both nearer and larger appear.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Mense maak en gebruik al vir duisende en duisende jare lense vir vergroting. Die eerste ware teleskope is egter in Europa in die laat 16de eeu gemaak. Daardie teleskope het ‘n kombinasie van twee lense gebruik om ver voorwerpe beide nader en groter te laat voorkom.
mt: People have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. The first true telescopes, however, were made in Europe in the late 16th century. Those telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects both nearer and larger appear.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Moehammad was diep geïnteresseerd in gebeure buite hierdie aardse lewe. Hy het gereeld ‘n grot besoek wat bekend geraak het as “Hira” op die Berg van “Noor” (lig) vir nadenke. Die grot self, wat lank oorleef het, gee ‘n baie duidelike beeld van Muhammad se spirituele neigings. Die grot is geheel en al geïsoleerd van die res van die wêreld, en rus bo-op een van die berge noord van Mekka. In der waarheid is dit nie maklik om te vind nie, selfs as 'n mens geweet het dit bestaan. Wanneer mens in 'n grot is, is dit 'n algehele isolasie. Niks anders as die skoon, pragtige lug bo en die baie omringende berge kan gesien word nie. Baie min van hierdie wêreld kan van binne die grot gehoor word.
mt: Muhammad was deeply interested in events outside this earthly life. He often visited a cave known as "Hira" on the Mountain of "Noor" (light) for contemplation. The cave itself, which has long survived, gives a very clear picture of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. The cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world, and rests atop one of the mountains north of Mecca. In truth, it is not easy to find, even if you knew it existed. When you are in a cave, it is an absolute isolation. Nothing else but the clean, beautiful air above and the very surrounding mountains can be seen. Very little of this world can be heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Waspore is gebou in Engeland so vroeg as die 16e eeu. Alhoewel waspore meestal bestaan het uit parallelle houtplanke, het hulle die perde wat hulle voortgesleep het toegelaat om dit teen groter snelhede en met groter vragte te doen as wat dit sou neem om dit op die bykans growwer paaie van die dag te doen. Dwarsbalke is redelik vroeg ingesit om die spore in plek te hou. Geleidelik is dit egter besef dat die spore egter doeltreffender sou wees indien daar ‘n ysterstrook aan die bokant was. Dit het algemene praktyk geword, maar die yster het meer afwerking van die hout wiele van die waens veroorsaak. Uiteindelik is houtwiele deur ysterwiele vervang. In 1767 is die eerste suiwer yster relings bekendgestel.
mt: Wagons were built in England as early as the 16th century. Although wagons were usually made of parallel wooden planks, they allowed the horses that pulled them to do so at greater speeds and with greater loads than it would take to do so on the almost rougher roads of the day. Crossbeams were relatively early inserted to keep the wagons in place. It was gradually realized, however, that the wagons would be more effective if there was an iron strip at the top. This became general practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the carts. Eventually wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767 the first pure iron rails were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
