src: Romantisisme het ‘n groot element kulturele determinisme bevat, geneem van skrywers soos Goethe, Fichte en Schlegel. In die konteks van die Romantiek, het die fisiese omgewing individue gevorm, en mettertyd het gebruike en kultuur onstaan wat aan daardie omgewing verbonde was, en hierdie dinge, wat in harmonie met die plek van die samelewing is, was beter as arbitrêr-opgelegde wette.
mt: Romanticism contained a large element of cultural determinism, taken from writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In the context of the Romanticism, the physical environment shaped individuals, and over time customs and culture arose that were tied to that environment, and these things, which were in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Tegnologiese bepaling is ‘n term wat ‘n wye reeks idees in praktyk behels, van tegnologiese-druk of die tegnologiese noodsaaklikheid in ‘n streng sin dat menslike lot gedryf is deur ‘n onderliggende logika gepaard met wetenskaplike wette en hulle manifestasie in tegnologie. Die meeste onderbrekings van tegnologiese bepalings deel twee algemene idees: dat die ontwikkeling van tegnologie self ‘n pad buite kulturele of politieke invloed volg, en dat tegnologie, op sy beurt, “effekte” op die samelewing lewer wat inheems is, in plaas van sosiaal gekondisioneer is. Byvoorbeeld, 'n mens mag sê dat die motorkar noodwendig tot die ontwikkeling van paaie gelei het. ‘n Landwye padnetwerk is egter nie ekonomies lewensvatbaar vir slegs ‘n handjievol karre nie, so nuwe metodes van produksie word ontwikkel om die kos van kar eienaarskap te verminder. Massa voertuig eienaarskap lei ook tot ongelukke op die pad, wat weer lei tot die uitvinding van nuwe tegnieke in die gesondheids-sorg vir die herstel van beskadigde liggame.
mt: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technological imperative or the technological necessity in a strict sense that human fate is driven by an underlying logic coupled with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interruptions of technological determinism share two common ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path outside cultural or political influence, and that technology, in turn, "effects" on society that are indigenous, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the automobile necessarily led to the development of roads. A nationwide road network is, however, not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to accidents on the road, which in turn leads to the invention of new techniques in health care for the repair of damaged bodies.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: Die “opboog” merkie lyk soos ‘n V en die “afboog” merkie lyk soos ‘n krammertjie of ‘n vierkantjie sonder sy onderste sy. Op beteken dat jy by die punt moet begin en die boog druk, en af beteken dat jy by die padda moet begin (dis waar jou hand die boog vashou) en die boog trek. ‘n Op-boog skep gewoonlik ‘n sagter klank, terwyl ‘n af-boog sterker en meer selfgeldend is. Voel vry om jou eie punte in te skryf, maar onthou dat die gedrukte lynmerke daar is vir ‘n musikale rede, so hulle moet normaalweg respekteer word.
mt: The “upstroke” mark looks like a V and the “downstroke” mark looks like a squiggle or a little square without its bottom side. Up means you start at the tip and the upstroke is pressed, and down means you start at the tail (this is where your hand holds the upstroke) and the upstroke is pulled. An upstroke usually creates a softer sound, while a downstroke is stronger and more self-sustaining. Feel free to add your own points, but remember that the printed line marks are there for a musical reason, so they should be respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: In teenstelling met aapsoorte, gebruik homeniedes nie meer hulle hande vir beweging of gewig dra of deur die bome swaai nie. Die sjimpansee se hand en voet is soortgelyk in grootte en lengte, wat die gebruik van die hand om gewig te dra deur kneukelloop weerspieël. Die menslike hand is korter as die voet, met phalankse wat meer reguit is. Fossiel hand-bene wat twee miljoen tot drie miljoen jaar oud is openbaar hierdie skuif in spesialisasie van die hand vanaf beweging tot manipulasie.
mt: In contrast to apes, humans no longer use their hands for locomotion or weight bearing or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the use of the hand for weight bearing through knuckle-walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with phalanges that are more upright. Fossil hand bones dating back two to three million years show this shift in specialization of the hand from movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Navorsing uit die twintigste eeu het gewys dat daar twee poele van genetiese variasie is: versteek en uitgedruk. Die mutasieproses voeg nuwe genetiese variasie by, en seleksie verwyder dit van die poel van uitgedrukte variasie. Segregasie en herkombinering meng variasie heen en weer tussen die twee poele van elke generasie.
mt: 20th century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. The mutational process adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination mix variation back and forth between the two pools of each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Op die savanne is dit moeilik vir 'n primaat met 'n spysverteringstelsel soos dié van mense om sy aminosuur behoeftes te bevredig met die plante wat daar beskikbaar is. Verder het versuim om dit te doen ernstige nagevolge: onderdrukte groei, wanvoeding en uiteindelik dood. Die maklikste toeganklike plantbronne sou die proteïene gewees het,wat in blare en peulgewasse voorkom, maar dit is moeilik vir primate soos ons om te verteer, tensy dit gekook word. In kontras is dierekosse (miere, termiete, eiers) nie net maklik verteerbaar nie, maar hulle bied hoë kwaliteit proteïne wat al die noodsaaklike aminosure bevat. Alles in ag genome, moet ons nie verbaas wees as ons voorgeslagte hul eie “protein probleem” opgelos het op ‘n manier soortgelyk aan die manier van sommige sjimpansees op die savanna vandag.
mt: On the savanna it is difficult for a primate with a digestive system like ours to satisfy its amino acid needs with the plants that are available. Further, failure to do so has serious consequences: stunted growth, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily available plant sources would have been the proteins found in leaves and legume pods, but it is difficult for primates like us to digest them unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal prey (ants, termites, eggs) are not only easily digestible, but they offer high quality protein containing all the necessary amino acids. Given the genome, we should not be surprised if our ancestors solved their “protein problem” in a way similar to the way some chimpanzees on the savanna today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Individue met eenderse gevoelens van verwaarlosing deur gemeenskapsstandaarde word deur subkulture saamgebring, en toegelaat om ‘n identiteitsgevoel te ontwikkel. Subkulture is kenmerkend vanweë die lede se ouderdom, etniese oorsprong, stand, ligging, en/of geslag. Die eienskappe wat ‘n subkultuur duidelik bepaal mag die taalkundige, estetiese, godsdienstige, politieke, seksuele, geografiese of ‘n kombinasie van faktore wees. Lede van ‘n subkultuur dui hul lidmaatskap gereeld aan deur ‘n kenmerkende en simboliese gebruik van style, wat modes, maniere, en informele taalgebruik insluit.
mt: Individuals with similar feelings of alienation from community standards are brought together, and allowed to develop an identity by subcultures. Subcultures are characterized by the members' age, ethnic origin, class, location, and/or gender. The characteristics that clearly define a subculture may be the linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often indicate their membership by a characteristic and symbolic use of styles, including fashions, manners, and informal language.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Kinders ontwikkel ‘n bewustheid van ras en ras-stereotipes redelik jonk en hierdie ras-stereotipes affekteer gedrag. Byvoorbeeld, kinders wat met ‘n rasseminderheid identifiseer wat gestereotipeerd word doen nie goed op skool vandat hulle eers geleer het oor die stereotipes wat met hul ras geassosieer word.
mt: Children develop an awareness of race and race stereotypes relatively young and these race stereotypes affect behavior. For example, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped do not do well in school after they learn about the stereotypes associated with their race.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Een van die algemeenste metodes wat gebruik word om die belangrikheid van sosialisering te illustreer, is deur te fokus op die paar ongelukkige gevalle van kinders wat deur verwaarlosing, ongunstige omstandighede of opsetlike mishandeling nie deur volwassenes gesosialiseer is terwyl die kinders grootgeword het nie. Sulke kinders word as ""weglopers"" of wild bestempel. Party wilde kinders is deur mense ingehok (gewoonlik hul eie ouers); in party gevalle is hierdie verlatenheid toe te skrywe aan ouers se verwerping van 'n kind se erge intellektuele of fisiese inperkings. Wilde kinders mag dalk ernstige kindermishandeling of trauma ervaar het voor hulle verlaat is of weggehardloop het. Dit word beweer dat ander deur diere grootgemaak is; party het op hul eie in die wildernis gebly. Wanneer 'n wilde kind geheel en al grootgemaak word deur nie-menslike diere stel dit gedrag (binne fisiese perke) ten toon wat byna geheel en al soos die bepaalde versorgende dier s'n is, soos die vrees of onverskilligheid jeens mense."
mt: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to focus on the few unfortunate cases of children who have not been socialized by adults while growing up. Such children are called "feral" or "wild." Some feral children have been confined (usually by their own parents); in some cases, this abandonment can be attributed to parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical limitations. Feral children may have experienced serious child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Some have been raised entirely by non-human animals; some have lived entirely on their own in the wilderness. When a feral child is raised entirely by non-human animals, it exhibits behavior (within physical limits) that is almost entirely like that of the particular caring animal, such as fear or indifference toward humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: "Een van die algemeenste metodes wat gebruik word om die belangrikheid van sosialisering te illustreer, is deur te fokus op die paar ongelukkige gevalle van kinders wat deur verwaarlosing, ongunstige omstandighede of opsetlike mishandeling nie deur volwassenes gesosialiseer is terwyl die kinders grootgeword het nie. Sulke kinders word as ""weglopers"" of wild bestempel. Party wilde kinders is deur mense ingehok (gewoonlik hul eie ouers); in party gevalle is hierdie verlatenheid toe te skrywe aan ouers se verwerping van 'n kind se erge intellektuele of fisiese inperkings. Wilde kinders mag dalk ernstige kindermishandeling of trauma ervaar het voor hulle verlaat is of weggehardloop het. Dit word beweer dat ander deur diere grootgemaak is; party het op hul eie in die wildernis gebly. Wanneer 'n wilde kind geheel en al grootgemaak word deur nie-menslike diere stel dit gedrag (binne fisiese perke) ten toon wat byna geheel en al soos die bepaalde versorgende dier s'n is, soos die vrees of onverskilligheid jeens mense."
mt: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to focus on the few unfortunate cases of children who have not been socialized by adults while growing up. Such children are called "feral" or "wild." Some feral children have been confined (usually by their own parents); in some cases, this abandonment can be attributed to parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical limitations. Feral children may have experienced serious child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Some have been raised entirely by non-human animals; some have lived entirely on their own in the wilderness. When a feral child is raised entirely by non-human animals, it exhibits behavior (within physical limits) that is almost entirely like that of the particular caring animal, such as fear or indifference toward humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Bestaansboerdery is boerdery wat gedoen word om net genoeg kos te produseer om die behoeftes van die boer en sy/haar familie te bevredig. Bestaans-landbou is ‘n eenvoudig, baiemaal organiese sisteem wat behoue saad wat eie is aan die ekostreek gekombineer met wisselverbouing of ander relatief maklike tegnieke om opbrengs te verhoog. Histories is meeste boere betrokke in bestaansboerderye en dit is steeds die geval in vele ontwikkelende nasies.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming done to produce just enough food to satisfy the needs of the farmer and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, largely organic system that combines locally adapted seeds with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to increase yields. Historically, most farmers were involved in subsistence farming and it is still the case in many developing nations.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Die mees algemene tipes toerisme wat meeste mense met toerisme assosieër is: Ontspannings Toerisme. Dit is wanneer mense ‘n plek toe gaan wat baie anders is as hul daaglikse lewe, en ontspan en hulself geniet. Strande, pretparke en kampeerterreine is meestal die mees algemene plekke wat deur ontspanningstoeriste besoek word. Indien die doelwit van ‘n mens se besoek aan ‘n besondere plek is om die geskiedenis en die kultuur te leer ken, dan staan hierdie tipe toerisme bekend as kulturele toerisme. Toeriste mag dalk verskillende landmerke besoek in ‘n spesifieke land of hulle mag dalk fokus net op een area.
mt: The most common types of tourism that most people associate with tourism are: Leisure Tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their daily lives, and relax and enjoy themselves. Beaches, amusement parks and campgrounds are usually the most common places visited by leisure tourists. If the purpose of a person's visit to a particular place is to learn about the history and the culture, then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks in a particular country or they may focus on one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Individue wat betrokke was vir verskeie dekades het ons gehelp om ons sterkpunte en passies te waardeer terwyl ons probleme en mislukkings assesseer. Terwyl ons geluister het na individue wat hul individuele, familie, en organisatoriese stories vertel het, het ons waardevolle insigte in die verlede bekom en sommige van die persoonlikhede wat die kultuur van die organisasie ten goede of kwade beïnvloed het. Terwyl 'n mens se verstandhouding van jou eie geskiedenis nie die aanname dat die kultuur verstaan word beteken nie, help dit mense om 'n sin te verkry van waar hulle binne die geskiedenis van die organisasie val. Gedurende die assesering van sukses en bewuswording van mislukkings, ontdek individue en die hele deelnemende groep dieper die waardes, missie, en dryfkrag van die organisasie. In hierdie geval, het die herinnering aan vorige gevalle van entrepreneuriese gedrag en die suksesse mense gehelp om oop te wees vir veranderinge en nuwe rigting vir die plaaslike kerk. Sulke suksesstories het die vrese van verandering verminder, terwyl dit 'n positiewe geneigdheid ten opsigte van verandering in die toekoms geskep het.
mt: Individuals who were involved for several decades helped us to appreciate our strengths and passions while we assessed our problems and failures. While we listened to individuals who told their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insights into the past and some of the personalities who influenced the culture of the organization for good or ill. While an understanding of your own history does not mean that the culture is understood, it helps people to gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. During the assessment of successes and awareness of failures, individuals and the entire participating group discover deeper the values, mission, and driving force of the organization. In this case, the remembering of past cases of entrepreneurial behavior and the successes people helped to open up to change and new direction for the local church. Such success stories helped to reduce the fears of change, while creating a positive inclination toward change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Die postmoderne benadering tot leer bied die vryheid van absolute. Daar is geen goeie een manier om te leer nie. Daar is waarlik geen een goeie ding om te leer nie. Leer neem plaas in die ervaring tussen die leerder en die kennis wat aangebied word. Ons huidige ervaring met al die doen-dit-self en informasie aanbiedings, leer-gebaseerde televisieprogramme illustreer hierdie punt. Soveel van ons bevind onsself waar ons 'n televisie program kyk wat ons inlig oor 'n proses of ervaring waarin ons nooit sou deelneem of daardie kennis sou toepas nie. Ons sal nooit ‘n kar oordoen, ‘n fontein in ons agterplaas bou, na Peru reis om oeroue bouvalle te ondersoek nie of ons bure se huis verbou nie.
mt: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom of absolutes. There is no one right way to learn. There is truly no one right thing to learn. Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge that is offered. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information offerings, learning-based television programs illustrate this point. So much of us find ourselves where we watch a television program that informs us about a process or experience in which we would never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never drive a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to study ancient ruins or remodel our neighbor’s house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Die onderbreking van slaap is die proses van om doelbewus wakker te word tydens jou normale slaap periode en ‘n kort rukkie daarna weer aan die slaap te raak (10-60 minute). Dit kan maklik gedoen word deur ‘n relatiewe stil alarmklok te gebruik om jou tot bewussein terug te bring sonder om jou ten volle wakker te maak. Indien jy jouself vang dat jy die klok in jou slaap instel, kan dit aan die ander kant van die kamer geplaas word, wat jou forseer om uit die bed te klim om dit af te sit. Ander bioritme-gebaseerde opsies sluit in die drink van baie vloeistowwe, (veral water of tee, ‘n bekende diuretiese middel), voor slapenstyd, wat ‘n mens forseer om op te staan dat jy kan urineer.
mt: The interruption of sleep is the process of deliberately waking up during your normal sleep period and then falling back asleep again (10-60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you back to consciousness without fully waking you up. If you catch yourself setting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options include drinking a lot of fluids, (especially water or tea, a well-known diuretic), before bedtime, forcing you to get up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Sommige mense glo dat die ervaring van baie gereelde kunsmatig geinduseerde duidelike drome baie uitputtend kan wees. Die hoof rede vir hierdie verskynsel is die gevolg van helder drome wat die tydperk tussen REM episodes verleng. Met minder REM per nag, is die staat waarin jou liggaam eintlik slaap ervaar en jou liggaam herstel ongereeld genoeg om ‘n probleem te word. Dit is net so uitputtend soos wanneer jy sou wakker word elke twintig of dertig minute en TV kyk. Die gevolg hang af van hoe gereeld per nag jou brein probeer om helder (lucid) te droom.
mt: Some people believe that the experience of very frequent artificially induced lucid dreams can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of vivid dreams that extend the period between REM episodes. With less REM per night, the state in which your body is actually sleeping and your body is healing is irregular enough to become a problem. It is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The result depends on how frequently per night your brain tries to dream lucidly.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Virtuele spanne word tot dieselfde standaarde van uitnemendheid as konvensionele spanne gehou, maar daar is subtiele verskille. Virtuele spanlede funksioneer gereeld as die kontakpunt vir hul onmiddelike fisiese groep. Hulle het gereeld meer outonomie as konvensionele spanlede aangesien hul spanne teen verskillende tydsones byeenkom wat dalk nie deur hul plaaslike bestuur verstaan sal word nie. Die teenwoordigheid van ‘n ware “onsigbare span” (Larson en LaFasto, 1989, bl109) is ook ‘n unieke komponent van ‘n visuele span. Die “onsigbare span” is die bestuurspan waaraan elkeen van die lede rapporteer. Die onsigbare span stel die standaarde daar vir elke lid.
mt: Virtual teams are held to the same standard of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the contact point for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members since their teams come together at different times of day which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p.109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each member reports. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Inhoudsteorieë is gesentreer rondom wat mense motiveer of behaag. Hierdie teorieë veronderstel dat mense sekere behoeftes en/of begeertes het wat geïnternaliseer word namate hulle volwasse word. Hierdie teorieë kyk wat dit is van sekere mense wat veroorsaak dat hulle die dinge wil hê wat hulle doen en die goed in hul omgewing wat hul sekere goed laat doen of nie doen. Twee populêre inhousteorieë is Maslow se Hiërargie van Behoeftes Teorie en Hertzberg se Twee Faktor Teorie.
mt: Content theories are centered around what motivates or satisfies people. These theories assume that people have certain needs and/or desires that are internalized as they mature. These theories look at what it is of certain people that causes them to want the things they do and the goods in their environment that they do or do not do. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Herzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Die veel-misbruikte en gereeld bespotte reël van derdes is 'n eenvoudige riglyn wat beweging skep terwyl dit 'n mate van orde in 'n beeld behou. Dit sê dat die mees effektiewe plek vir die hoofonderwerp is by die kruising van lyne wat die prent vertikaal en horisontaal in derdes opdeel(sien voorbeeld).
mt: The much-abused and frequently derided rule of thirds is a simple guideline that creates movement while maintaining a degree of order in an image. It says that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines that divide the print vertically and horizontally into thirds (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Byvoorbeeld, die mees algemene stil beeld fotografie formaat in die wêreld is 35mm, wat die dominante film grootte was teen die einde van die analoog film era. Dit word nogsteeds vervaardig vandag, maar meer belangrik is dat die aspek verhouding oorgeerf is deur digitale kamera beeld sensor formate. Die 35mm formaat is eintlik, ietwat verwarrend, 36mm breed en 24mm hoog. Die beeldverhouding van hierdie formaat (deur twaalf te deel om die eenvoudigste heelgetalverhouding te verkry) is derhalwe 3: 2. Baie algemene formate (byvoorbeeld die APS familie van formate) is gelykstaande aan of naby geskat aan hierdie aspek verhouding.
mt: 35mm is the most common still image photography format in the world, which was the dominant film size at the end of the analog film era. It is still manufactured today, but more importantly, the aspect ratio has been carried over by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm wide and 24mm high. The aspect ratio of this format (by dividing by twelve to get the simplest whole number ratio) is therefore 3:2. Many common formats (for example the APS family of formats) are similar to or close to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Die nadele van zoomlense is dat die ingewikkeldheid van die fokus en aantal lens elemente wat vereis word om ‘n reeks fokuslengtes te verkry veel groter is as vir prima lense. Hierdie begin minder van ‘n probleem word aangesien lens vervaardigers hoër standaarde in lens produksie verkry. Hierdie het fokus lense toegelaat om fotos van kwaliteit vergelykbaar met lense van vasgestelde fokale lengte te maak. ‘n Ander nadeel van fokuslense is dat die maksimum diafragma (die spoed) van die lens normaalweg laer is. Dit maak die goedkoop zoom lense moeilik om te gebruik in lae-beligtingskondisies sonder ‘n ‘flash’.
mt: The disadvantages of zoom lenses are that the complexity of the focus and the number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is less of a problem as lens manufacturers have achieved higher standards in lens production. This has allowed focus lenses to make photographs of quality comparable to lenses of fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of focus lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes the cheap zoom lenses difficult to use in low-lighting conditions without a "flash".
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mistisisme is die navolging of gemeenskaplikheid met, identifisering met, of bewustheid van ‘n uiteindelike realiteit, geestelike waarheid, of God. Die gelowige soek ‘n direkte ondervinding, intuïsie, of insig in goddelike werklikheid/die godheid of gode. Volgelinge streef sekere lewenstyle na, of praktyke wat beoog om sulke ervarings te koester. Mistisisme kan onderskei word van ander vorme van godsdienstige geloof en aanbidding deur die klem op direkte persoonlike ervaring van ‘n unieke toestand van bewustheid, veral die van ‘n rustige, insigvolle, salige en selfs ekstatiese karakter.
mt: Mysticism is the pursuit of direct communion with, identification with, or awareness of an ultimate reality, spiritual truth, or God. The mystic seeks direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/god or gods. Followers strive for certain lifestyles, or practices that aim to nurture such experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by the emphasis on direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly that of a quiet, insightful, blissful and even ecstatic character.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Vir ‘n lang tyd gedurende die negentiende en die twintigste eeue is daar geglo dat die eerste bewoners van Nieeu-Seeland die Maori mense was, wat groot voëls genaamd moas, gejag het. Die teorie het die idee bevestig dat die Maori mense migreer het van Polenisië in ‘n Groot Vloot en het New Zeeland gevat van die Moriori, en daardeur ‘n landbou gemeenskap gestig het. Nuwe bewyse suggereer egter dat die Moriori ‘n groep van die hoofland Maori was wat migreer het van New Zeeland na die Chatham Eilande, waar hul hul eie kenmerkende,vredeliewende kultuur ontwikkel het. Daar was ook 'n ander Maori-stam op die Chatham eilande wat migreer het van Nieu-Seeland af. Hulle het hulleself die Moriori genoem, daar was ‘n paar skermutselinge, en die Moriori is uitgewis aan die einde.
mt: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people who hunted large birds called moas. The theory confirmed the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, and thus established an agricultural community. New evidence, however, suggests that the Moriori was a group of the main land Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, where they developed their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another Maori tribe on the Chatham Islands who migrated from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori, there were a few skirmishes, and the Moriori were wiped out at the end.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland Origami is origami met die perke dat daar slegs een vou op ‘n keer gedoen mag word, terwyl meer komplekse vouwerk soos omgekeerde voue nie toelaatbaar is nie, en alle voue het duidelike plasings. Dit is in die 1970’s deur John Smith ontwikkel om onervare vouers of die met beperkte motoriese vaardighede te help.
mt: Pureland Origami is origami with the restrictions that only one fold may be done at a time, while more complex folds such as reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have clear placements. It was developed in the 1970’s by John Smith to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Die Indus Vallei Beskawing was ‘n Brons-eeu beskawing in die noordwes-Indiese subkontinent wat die meeste van die hedendaagse Pakistan en ander streke in die noordweste van Indië en noordoos-Afghanistan omsluit. Die beskawing het floreer in die bekken van die Indusrivier, vanwaar die naam afgelei is. Al spekuleer party kenners dat sedert die beskawing ook bestaan het in die komme van die huidig opgedroogde Sarasvati Rivier, dit gepas die Indus-Sarasvati Beskawing genoem behoort te word, terwyl party dit die Harappen Beskawing noem, na Harappa, die eerste van die terreine wat in die 1920s opgegrawe is.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern Indian subcontinent, dating from the Indus River basin area of Pakistan and western India. The civilization flourished in the basins of the Indus River, which flows through the length of Pakistan, and the Ghaggar-Hakra river, which flows through western India and eastern Pakistan. Some scholars suggest that the Indus Valley Civilization also extended into the Sarasvati River, which dried up in the late Harappan period, and thus the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization should be called. Others call it the Harappan Civilization, after Harappa, the first of the sites found.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Gierigheid en selfsug sal altyd met ons wees en dit is die aard van samewerking dat wanneer die meerderheid voordeel trek sal daar altyd meer gewin wees daarin om op die kort termyn selfsugtig op te tree. Hopelik, sal meeste mense besef dat die beste langtermyn opsie is om saam met ander te werk.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more gain in acting selfishly in the short term. Hopefully, most people will realize that the best long-term option is to work together with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Die oorlogsonkostes van V.S imperialisme in die verowering van die Filipyne is voor betaal deur die Filipynse mense self. Hulle word verplig om belasting aan die VS koloniale regime te betaal om ‘n groot deel van die uitgawes op te los en die rente op effekte het deur die Wall Straat bankhuise in die naam van die Filippynse regering gedryf. Natuurlik, die super profyte wat verkry is van die uitgerekte uitbuiting van die Filipynse mense, sou die basisiese winste van die V.S. imperialisme uitmaak.
mt: The war costs of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to help defray a large part of the expenses and the interest on the bonds was driven by Wall Street banks in the name of the Filipino government. Of course, the super profits gained from the extended exploitation of the Filipino people would make up the basic profits of U.S. imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Om die Tempeldienaars te verstaan moet mens die konteks verstaan wat tot die stigting van die orde gelei het. Die era waar die gebeure plaasgevind het, is algemeen na verwys as die Hoë Middel Eeue, die periode van die Europese geskiedenis in die 11de, 12de, en 13de eeue (AD 1000-1300). Die Hoë Middeleeue was voorafgegaan deur die Vroeë Middeleeue en gevolg deur die Laat Middeleeue, wat deur konvensie rondom 1500 ge-eindig het.
mt: To understand the Temple Priests one must understand the context that led to the founding of the order. The era in which the events took place is generally referred to as the High Middle Ages, the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000-1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which ended around 1500 by convention.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Die militaristiese aard van die Romeinse Ryk het gehelp met die ontwikkeling van mediese vooruitgang. Keiser Augustus het dokters begin werf en selfs die eerste Romeinse Mediese Korps gevorm om na gevegte te werk. Chirurge het kennis van verskeie kalmeermiddels gehad, insluitend morfien van uittreksels van papawersaad en scopolamien van herbane sade. Hulle het vaardig geraak met amputasies om pasiënte van gangreen te red, asook toernikette en bloedvaat klampe om bloedvloei te stuit. Oor vele eeue heen het die Romeinse ryk tot groot ontwikkelings op die gebied van medisyne gelei en baie van die kennis wat ons vandag het, gevorm.
mt: The military nature of the Roman Empire helped with the development of medical progress. Emperor Augustus began hiring doctors and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps to work after battles. Surgeons were familiar with several sedatives, including morphine from extracts of papaw seeds and scopolamine from henbane seeds. They became skilled with amputations to save patients from gangrene, as well as tourniquets and blood vessel clamps to stop bleeding. Over many centuries, the Roman Empire led to great developments in the field of medicine and much of the knowledge we have today, formed.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Visie, of die vermoë om te sien maak staat op die sensoriese organe of oë van die visuele stelsel. Daar is baie verskillende oog konstruksies, verskillend in kompleksiteit afhangend van die vereistes van die organisme. Die verskillende konstruksies het verskillende vermoëns, en is sensitief vir verskillende golflengtes en het verskillende grade van akkuraatheid, en hulle vereis verskillende prosessering om sin te maak uit die input en verskillende getalle om optimaal te werk.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see depends on the sensory organs or eyes of the visual system. There are many different eye constructions, differing in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different abilities, and are sensitive to different wavelengths and have different degrees of accuracy, and they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhism is ‘n geloof van die Indiese sub-kontinent. Dit het in die Punjab streek gedurende die 15de eeu onstaan as gevolg van ‘n sektariese skeuring binne die Hindoe tradisie. Sikhs beskou hul geloof as ‘n aparte geloof van Hindoeísme al gee hulle erkenning aan die Hindoe wortels en tradisies. Sikhs noem hul geloof Gurmat, wat Punjabi is vir “manier van die ghoeroe”. ‘n Ghoeroe is ‘n fundamentele aspek van alle Indiese gelowe, maar in Sikhisme is dit so belangrik dat dit die middelpunt van die geloof vorm. Die geloof was in die 15de eeu ontdek deur Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Daar het in opvolging ‘n verdere nege gurus gevolg.
mt: Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It originated in the Punjab region in the 15th century as a sectaries split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs regard their faith as a separate religion from Hinduism, although they acknowledge the Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their faith Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the gurus". A guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions, but in Sikhism it is so important that it forms the centerpiece of the faith. The faith was discovered in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). There followed in succession nine more gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Aandag Afleibaarheids Sindroom “is ‘n neurologiese sindroom waarvan die klassieke definierende drievoud van simptome impulsiwiteit, afleibaarheid en hiperaktiwiteit of oortollige energie insluit”. Dit is nie ‘n leer gestremdheid nie, dit is ‘n leer versteuring; dit “affekteer 3 tot 5 persent van alle kinders, moontlik so baie soos 2 miljoen Amerikaanse kinders”. Kinders met ATS vind dit moeilik om te fokus op dinge soos skoolwerk, maar hulle kan konsentreer op dinge soos speel, om hul gunsteling tekenprente te kyk of sinne sonder leestekens te skryf. Hierdie kinders neig daartoe om in baie moeilikheid te kom omdat hulle in ""risikogedrag betrokke raak, aan die baklei raak, en outoriteit uitdaag"" om hul verstande te stimuleer, aangesien hul breine nie deur normale metodes gestimuleer kan word nie. AAS affekteer verhoudinge met makkers omdat ander kinders nie kan verstaan hoekom hulle op die manier reaggeer wat hulle doen nie of hoekom hulle spel soos hulle doen of hul volwassenheidsvlak anders is nie."
mt: "Attention Deficit Disorder" is a neurological disorder whose classical defining triad of symptoms includes impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excessive energy. It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, possibly as many as 2 million American children." Children with ADHD find it difficult to focus on things like schoolwork, but they can concentrate on things like play, watching their favorite cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into trouble because they engage in "risk-taking behavior, get into fights, and challenge authority" to stimulate their minds, since their brains cannot be stimulated by normal methods. ADHD affects relationships with peers because other children cannot understand why they react in the way they do or why they play as they do or why their adult level is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Terwyl projek gebaseerde leer dit makliker en interessanter behoort te maak om te leer, gaan steierwerk ‘n stap verder. Steierwerk is nie ‘n metode om te leer nie, maar eerder ‘n hulpmiddel wat ondersteuning bied aan individue wat ‘n nuwe leer metode begin gebruik, soos ‘n nuwe rekenaarprogram of die begin van ‘n nuwe projek. Steiers kan beide virtueel of werklik wees, in ander woorde, ‘n onderwyser is ‘n vorm van steier maar so ook die klein skuifspeld mannetjie in Microsoft Office. Virtuele Steiers is in die sagteware en is bedoel om prosedures te bevraagteken, te versnel, en te verduidelik vir studente wat die proses moeilik sou vind om op hul eie te hanteer.
mt: While project-based learning is supposed to make it easier and more interesting to learn, scaffolding takes it a step further. Scaffolding is not a method of learning, but rather a tool that provides support to individuals who are beginning to use a new learning method, such as a new computer program or the start of a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and physical, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffolding but so is the little pushpin man in Microsoft Office. Virtual scaffolds are in the software and are intended to question, speed up, and clarify procedures for students who would find the process difficult to handle on their own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace is die derde mees bekende webtuiste wat in die Vereenigde State van Amerika gebruik word en wat tans 54 miljoen profiele het. Hierdie webtuistes het baie aandag gekry, veral teen die huidige onderwysagtergrond. Daai is positiewe aspekte tot daardie webtuistes, insluitend die vermoë om ‘n bladsy maklik op te stel wat blogs, videos, fotos, en ander kenmerke insluit. Toegang tot hierdie bladsy kan maklik gedoen word deur net een webadres te verskaf, wat dit maklik maak om te onthou en maklik is om in te tik vir studente wat probleme kan hê, om die sleutelbord te gebruik of spelprobleme het. Dit kan aangepas word om dit maklik leesbaar te maak en ook met so baie of min kleur as wat u wil hê.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and currently has 54 million profiles. These websites have received a lot of attention, especially against the current educational background. That is a positive aspect to those websites, including the ability to easily set up a page that includes blogs, videos, photos, and other features. Access to these pages can easily be done by simply providing one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type for students who may have problems using the keyboard or spelling problems. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with so many or as little color as you want.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: In Junie 1956 was Krushchev se beloftes egter op die proef gestel, toe onluste in Pole, waar werkers teen voedseltekorte en loonbesnoeiings geprotesteer het, het dit'n algemene protes teen Kommunisme geword. Al het Kruchev op die ou end tenks ingestuur om orde te herstel, het hy toegegee aan party ekonomiese eise en toegestem om die gewilde Wladyslaw Gomulka as die nuwe eersteminister aan te stel.
mt: 1956, however, Krushchev's promises were tested, when riots in Poland, where workers protested against food shortages and wage cuts, had become a general protest against Communism. Although Kruchev eventually sent in tanks to restore order, he eventually conceded to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Duitsland was ‘n gesamentlike vyand in Wêreldoorlog 2, gelei deur die USSR en VSA. Met die einde van die oorlog en botsings van sisteem, proses en kultuur wat gelei het tot die lande wat uitgeval het. Binne twee jaar na die einde van die oorlog was voormalige geallieerdes huidige vyande en het die Koue Oorlog begin. Dit was die laaste vir die volgende 40 jaar en sou werklik geveg word, deur instaan troepe, op slagvelde van Afrika na Asië, in Afghanistan, Kuba en baie ander plekke.
mt: Germany was a joint enemy in World War 2, led by the USSR and USA. With the end of the war and clashes of systems, processes and culture that led to the countries falling apart. Within two years after the end of the war former allies were current enemies and the Cold War began. This was the last for the next 40 years and would really be fought, instead of troops, on battlefields of Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Die Senustelsel handhaaf hemeostase deur senu impulse deur die lyf te stuur om bloedvloei aan die gang en onversteurd te hou. Hierdie senuwee impulse kan so vinnig regdeur die liggaam gestuur word en dit veilig help hou van enige potensiële bedreiging.
mt: The  sensory system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through the body to keep blood flowing and unimpeded. These nerve impulses can be sent quickly throughout the body and help keep any potential threat safe.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Die Groot Piramide by Giza is die enigste een van die sewe wonders wat vandag nog staan. Gebou deur die Egiptenare in die derde eeu VGE, is die Groot Piramide een van die baie groot piramide strukture wat gebou is om die dood van Farao te eer. Die Giza Plato, of “Giza Nekropolis” in die Egiptiese Vallei van die Dode bevat verskeie piramides (waarvan die groot piramide die grootste is), verskeie klein grafte, verskeie tempels en die groot Sphinx. Die groot piramiede is geskep ter ere van die Farao Khufu, en baie van die kleiner piramides, graftombes en tempels is gebou om Khufu se vroue en familielede te vereer.
mt: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that still stands. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of the many large pyramid structures built to honor the death of Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or “Giza Necropolis” in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the Great Pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramids were created in honor of Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs and temples were built to honor Khufu’s wives and family members.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Die Tempel van Artemis by Ephesus was verwoes op Julie 21, 356 VC in ‘n brandstigtings aksie deur Herostratus. Volgens die storie was sy motivering roem ten alle koste. Die Efese, wat verontwaardig was, het aangekondig dat Herostratus se naam nooit opgeteken sou word nie. Die Griekse geskiedkundige, Strabo het later die name neergeskryf, wat is hoe hulle vandag bekend staan. Die tempel is dieselfde aand wat Aleksander die Grote gebore is, vernietig. Aleksander het as koning beloof om die tempel te herbou, maar sy aanbod is geweier. Later, na Aleksander oorlede is, is die tempel in 323 v.C. herbou.
mt: The Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BC in a firebombing action by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at all costs. The Ephesians, who were outraged, announced that Herostratus' name would never be recorded. The Greek historian, Strabo later wrote down the names, which is how they are known today. The temple was destroyed the same night that Alexander the Great was born, destroyed. Alexander promised to rebuild the temple, but his offer was refused. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Die eerste bekende manier van vervoer was loop, mense het twee miljoen jaar gelede regop begin loop met die opkoms van Homo Erectus (wat beteken regop mens). Hulle voorganger, die Australopithecus het nie normaalweg regop geloop nie. Tweevoetige spesialisasies word in Australopithecus fossiele gevind vanaf 4.2 - 3.9 miljoen jaar gelede, hoewel Sahelanthropus al op twee bene geloop het so vroeg soos sewe miljoen jaar gelede.
mt: The first known method of transportation was walking, people began walking upright two million years ago with the rise of Homo Erectus (which means upright man). Their predecessor, the Australopithecus did not normally walk upright. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2 - 3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus already walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Die gebruik van skepe om goedere te vervoer is by verre die mees effektiewe manier om groot hoeveelhede mense en goedere oor die oseane te verskuif. Die werk van die vlote was tradisioneel om te verseker dat jou land die vermoë behou om jou mense en goedere te verskuif, terwyl dit terselfdetyd met jou vyand se vermoë om sy mense en goedere te skuif, inmeng. Een van die mees merkwaardige onlangse voorbeelde hiervan was die Noord Atlantiese ekspedisie van WWII. Die Amerikaners het gepoog om manskappe en voorraade oor die Atlantiese Oseaan te kry om Brittanje te help. Terselfdetyd, die Duitsevloot, wat meestal U-bote gebruik het prober om die verkeer te stop. Het die Geallieërdes gefaal, sou Duitsland heel moontlik in staat wees om Brittanje te oorwin aangesien dit die res van Europa kon oorwin.
mt: The use of ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across the oceans. The work of the fleets was traditionally to ensure that your country retains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most remarkable recent examples of this was the North Atlantic Expedition of WWII. The Americans tried to get troops and supplies across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German fleet, which mostly used U-boats, tried to stop the traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany would most likely have been able to win Britain as it could have won the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Die ontdekking van speekwiele maak Assiriese waens ligter, vinniger, en beter voorbereid om weg te jaag vir soldate en ander waens. Pyle van hul dodelike kruisboë kon die pantser van mededingende soldate deurboor. Om en by 1000 V.C., het die Assiriërs die eerste ruitery bekend gestel. n Kavallerie is 'n weermag wat te perd veg. Die saal is nog nie uitgevind nie, so Assiriese kavallerie het bloots te perd geveg.
mt: The discovery of the spoked wheel makes Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to run down soldiers and other chariots. Arrows of their deadly crossbows could pierce the armor of competing soldiers. Around 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first chariotry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The word is not yet invented, so Assyrian cavalry fought only on horseback.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Die Babiloniërs het vir elkeen van hul gode ‘n hooftempel gebou wat as die tuiste van die godheid beskou is. Mense sou offerande bring aan die gode en die priesters sou probeer om die behoeftes van die gode deur seremonies en feeste te bevredig. Elke tempel het ‘n oop binnehof gehad end dan ‘n binnekamer waar slegs die priesters kon ingaan. Soms is spesiale piramide vorm torings, ook genoeg ziggurats, gebou om deel van die tempels te wees. Die boonste kant van die toring was spesiale heiligdom vir die god.
mt: The Babylonians built a main temple for each of their gods, which was considered the home of the god. People would bring offerings to the gods and the priests would try to satisfy the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard and then an inner chamber where only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid-shaped towers, also known as ziggurats, were built as part of the temples. The top of the tower was a special holy place for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Ja! Koning Toetankamen, soms verwys na as “Koning Toet” of “Die Seun Koning”, is een van die mees welbekende antieke Egiptiese konings in moderne tye. Interesant genoeg, was hy nie baie belangrik geag in antike tye nie en is nie aangeteken op meeste antieke konings lyste nie. Die ontdekking van sy graf in 1922 het hom egter ‘n beroemdheid gemaak. Terwyl baie grafte van die verlede beroof is, was die graf amper ongestoord gewees. Meeste van die items wat saam met Tutankhamun begrawe is, is goed bewaar, insluitend duisende artefakte gemaak van kosbare metale en skaars edelgesteentes.
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as “King Tut” or “The Boy King”, is one of the most well-known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not very highly regarded in ancient times and is not listed on most ancient kings lists. The discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past have been robbed, his tomb was almost undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun are well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare gemstones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Ons ken baie Grieke politici, wetenskaplikes, en kunstenaars. Moontlik die mees bekende mens van die kultuur is Homer, die legendaariese blinde digter, wat twee meesterstukke van Griekeliteratuur saamgestel het: die gedigte Iliad en Odyssey. Sophokles en Aristophanes is nog steeds gewilde dramaturge en hul drama’s word beskou as party van die grootste werke van wêreldliteratuur. Nog ‘n beroemde Griek is die wiskundige, Pythagoras, veral bekend vir sy beroemde stelling oor die verhoudings van die sye van ‘n regte driehoek.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most famous man of the culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who compiled two masterpieces of Greek literature: the epics Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular dramatists and their dramas are considered part of the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is the mathematician, Pythagoras, especially known for his famous theorem about the ratios of the sides of a right triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: In die warm klimaat van die Midde-Ooste, was die huis nie so belangrik nie. Meeste van die lewe van die Hebreeuse familie het in die ope lug gebeur. Vroue het in die tuin gekook; winkels is net oop toonbanke wat op die straat uitgekyk het. Klippe was gebruik om huis mee te bou. Daar was geen groot woude in die land van Kanaan nie so hout was baie duur.
mt: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family took place outdoors. Women cooked in the garden; shops were just open-air stalls that looked out onto the street. Stones were used to build houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan so wood was very expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
