src: Groenland is yl bevolk. In Noorse sagas word daar vertel dat Erik die Rooie uit Ysland verban is oor moord, en terwyl hy verder wes gereis het, het hy Groenland gevind en dit Groenland genoem. Maar ongeag van sy ontdekking, het Eskimo stamme reeds daar gewoon. Alhoewel elke land ‘Skandinawies’ was, was daar baie verskille tussen die mense, konings, gebruike en geskiedenis van Denemarke, Swede, Noorweë en Ysland.
mt: Greenland is sparsely populated. In Norse sagas it is told that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland over murder, and while he sailed west he found Greenland and named it Greenland. But despite his discovery, Eskimo tribes had already lived there. Although each country was “Scandinavian”, there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Terwyl baie van hul kos bekend aan ons sou wees, het die Romeine hul eie aandeel van vreemde of ongewone feeste gehad wat wilde vark, pou, slak, en 'n tipe buideldier wat as 'n Hazelmuis bekend staan. ‘n Ander verskil was dat terwyl die arm mense en die vrou hul kos eet terwyl hul in stoele sit,die ryk mans dit verkies het om bankette saam te hou waar hul op hul sye lê en hul maaltye eet. Antieke Romeinse etes kon nie kos ingesluit het wat Europa toe gekom het van Amerika nie, of van Asië in latere eeue nie. Byvoorbeeld, hulle het nie mielies, of tamaties, of aartappels, of kakao gehad nie en geen Romein het ooit kalkoen geproe nie.
mt: While many of their food would be familiar to us, the Romans had their own share of foreign or unusual feasts that included wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent known as the hazel mouse. Another difference was that while the poor people and the women ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men preferred to hold banquets where they lay on their sides and ate their meals. Ancient Roman feasts could not have included food that Europe came from America or Asia in later centuries, for example, they did not have corn, or tomatoes, or potatoes, or cocoa and no Roman ever tasted chicken.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: 'n Beskawing is 'n enkele kultuur wat gedeel word deur 'n beduidende groot groep mense wat saamwerk en as ‘n gemeenskap leef en werk. Die word civilization kom van die Latynse word civilis, wat civil betekn, verwant aan die Latynse civis, menende burger, en civitas, menend stad of soos ‘n stad, en dit definieer ook die grootte van die samelewing. Stadstate is die voorlopers van nasies. ‘n Beskaafde kultuur dy op die oordra van kennis oor vele generasies, ‘n voortslepende kulterele voetspoor en billike verspreiding. Kleiner kulture verdwyn gereeld sonder om relevante historiese bewyse na te laat en slaag nie daarin om as behoorlike beskawings erken te word nie.
mt: A civilization is a single culture shared by a significant large group of people who work together and live and work as a community. The word civilization comes from the Latin word civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or as a city, and it also defines the size of the community. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilized culture is one that passes on knowledge over many generations, a continuing cultural footprint and fair distribution. Smaller cultures often disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: 'n Beskawing is 'n enkele kultuur wat gedeel word deur 'n beduidende groot groep mense wat saamwerk en as ‘n gemeenskap leef en werk. Die word civilization kom van die Latynse word civilis, wat civil betekn, verwant aan die Latynse civis, menende burger, en civitas, menend stad of soos ‘n stad, en dit definieer ook die grootte van die samelewing. Stadstate is die voorlopers van nasies. ‘n Beskaafde kultuur dy op die oordra van kennis oor vele generasies, ‘n voortslepende kulterele voetspoor en billike verspreiding. Kleiner kulture verdwyn gereeld sonder om relevante historiese bewyse na te laat en slaag nie daarin om as behoorlike beskawings erken te word nie.
mt: A civilization is a single culture shared by a significant large group of people who work together and live and work as a community. The word civilization comes from the Latin word civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or as a city, and it also defines the size of the community. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilized culture is one that passes on knowledge over many generations, a continuing cultural footprint and fair distribution. Smaller cultures often disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Die Drukgyal Dzong is ‘n geruïneerde fort en Budhisteklooster in die boonste deel van die Paro Distrik (in die dorpie, Phondey). Daar word gesê dat Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel die fort in 1649 gebou het om sy oorwinning teen die Tibetaans-Mongoolse magte te herdenk. In 1951 het 'n brand veroorsaak dat slegs party van die aandenkings van die Drukgyal Dzong oorgebly het, soos die beeld van Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Na die vuur was die vesting bewaar en beskerm, oorblywend as een van Bhutan se mees sensasionele aantreklikhede.
mt: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fort and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in the village, Phondey). It is said that Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fort in 1649 to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. In 1951 a fire caused that only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong remained, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining as one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Tydens die 18de eeu is Kambodja tussen twee magtige bure, Thailand en Vietnam. Die Thais het Cambodia verskeie kere ingeval in die 18e eeu en in 1772 het hulle Phnom Phen vernietig. In die laaste jare van die 18de eeu het die Vietnamese ook Cambodia ingeval.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taiwan het lank gelede begin in die 15de eeu waar Europese vaarders verbygevaar het om die eiland se naam as Ilha Formose op te neem, of pragtige eiland. In 1624 het die Nederlandse Oos Indiese Kompanjie 'n basis suidwes Taiwan gevestig, en 'n transformasie in inboorling graanproduksie praktyke deur Sjinese arbeiders aan te stel om te werk in hul rys en suikerplantasies. Qing dinastie (1644 – 1912) magte het in 1683 beheer geneem van Taiwan se westelike en noordelike kus areas en Taiwan as n provinsie van die Qing Ryk in 1885 verklaar. In 1895, na ‘n nederlaag in die Eerste Sino-Japanese Oorlog (1894-1895), teken die Qing regering die Beleid van Shimonoseki, waardeur hulle sowereiniteit oor Taiwan aan Japan oordra, wat die eiland tot 1945 regeer.
mt: Taiwan has long been known in the 15th century where European sailors passed by to take the island's name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, and a transformation in indigenous grain production practices by Chinese laborers to work in their rice and sugar plantations. Qing dynasty (1644 – 1912) forces took control of Taiwan's western and northern coastal areas in 1683 and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after a defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which they ceded sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Hierdie word ‘n chemiesese middel se pH genoem. Jy kan ‘n aanwyser maak deur rooi koolsap te gebruik. Die koolsap verander kleur afhangend van hoe suur of basies (alkalies) die chemiese stof is. Die pH vlak word aangedui deur die hoeveelheid Waterstof ( die H in die pH) ione in die chemikalie wat getoets word. Waterstof ione is protone waarvan die elektrone afgehaal is (aangesien Waterstof atome bestaan uit een proton en een elektron).
mt: This is called the pH of a chemical solution. You can make an indicator by using red cabbage juice. The juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in the pH) ions in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons from which the electrons have been removed (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Leeus is die mees sosiale katte, wat in groot groepe woon bekend as troppe. Leeutroppe bestaan uit een tot drie verwante mannetjies, tesame met soveel as dertig wyfies en kleintjies. Die vrouens is gewoonlik nou verwant aan mekaar, wese ‘n groot familie van susters en dogters. Leeu troppe tree baie op soos ‘n trop wolwe of honde, diere wat verbasend na aan leeus is (maar nie aan ander groot katte nie) in optrede, en ook baie dodelik is vir hul prooi.
mt: Lions are the most social of cats, living in large groups known as prides. Lion prides consist of one to three related males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to one another, making up a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act very much like a pack of wolves or dogs, animals that are remarkably like lions (but not other large cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Onder hulle is meer medium grootte katte wat medium grootte prooi eet soos hase en bokke. Laastens, daar is baie klein katjies (insluitend loslopende troeteldier katte) wat verreweg heelwat meer klein prooi soos insekte, knaagdiere, akkedisse en voëls eet. Die geheim tot hul sukses is die konsep van ‘n nis, elke kat het ‘n spesiale werk wat dit verhoed om the kompeteer met ander.
mt: Among them are medium-sized cats that eat medium-sized prey such as rabbits and antelopes. Finally, there are many small kittens (including stray pet cats) that eat far smaller prey such as insects, rodents, hedgehogs and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of a niche, each cat has a special job that prevents it from competing with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Klein wildekatte hou daarvan om klein diertjies te eet. Hulle sal apies, slange, knaagdiere en voëls vang as hulle kan. Byna al die diere wat die wildekat jag is kleiner as wat hulle is. Wetenskaplikes dink dat “oselotte” diere (prooi) volg en vind deur reuk. Hulle snuif op die grond om uit te vind waar die diere was. Hulle kan baie goed in die donker met nagvisie sien, en beweeg ook wel ongesiens. Pardelkatte jag hulle prooi deur met die omgewing saam te smelt en dan hulle slagoffers te bespring.
mt: 1. Small wildcats like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all the animals that the wildcat hunts are smaller than it is. Scientists think that "oselotte" animals (prey) follow and find by smell. They sniff on the ground to find out where the animals were. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and also move well unseen. Pardelcats hunt their prey by blending in with the environment and then pouncing on their victims.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: As ‘n goed-afgeronde atleet, kan die tier klim (al is dit nie goed nie), swem, groot afstande spring en trek met vyf keer die krag van ‘n sterk mens. Die tier is in dieselfde groep (Genus Panthera) as leeus, luiperds, en jaguars. Hierdie vier katte is die enigstes wat kan brul. Die tier se brul is nie soos die volstem brul van ‘n leeu nie, maar meer soos ‘n sin van snerpende geskreeude woorde.
mt: As a well-rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (although not very well), swim, jump long distances, and pull with five times the strength of a strong man. The tiger is in the same genus (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. The tiger’s roar is not like the full-throated roar of a lion, but more like a string of shrieking words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: ‘n Sel is die kleinste strukturele en funksionele eenheid van ‘n lewende (dinge) organisme. Sel kom vanaf die Latynse word cella wat klein kamertjie beteken. Indien jy na lewende dinge kyk onder 'n mikroskoop, sal jy sien dat hulle uit klein vierkante of balletjies bestaan. Robert Hooke, ‘n bioloog van Engeland, het met ‘n mikroskoop klein vierkantjies in kurk gesien. Dit lyk soos kamers. Hy was die eerste person wat die dooie selle gesien het.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means little chamber. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. It looks like chambers. He was the first person to see dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Diere is gemaak van baie selle. Hulle eet goed en verteer dit aan die binnekant. Meeste diere kan beweeg. Slegs diere het 'n brein (maar nie alle diere het nie; jellievisse het byvoorbeeld nie ‘n brein nie). Diere word regoor die aarde gevind. Hulle grawe in die grond, swem n die seë, en vlieg in die lug.
mt: Animals are made of many cells. They eat well and digest it inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have a brain (but not all animals have one; jellyfishes, for example, do not have a brain). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the seas, and fly in the air.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Plante maak suurstof wat mense inasem, en hulle neem in koolstofdioksied wat mense uitasem (dit wil sê, uitasem). Plante maak hul eie kos uit sonlig deur fotosintese. Hulle bied ook skaduwee. Ons gebruik plante om ons huise te bou en om klere te maak. Meeste kos wat ons eet is plante. Sonder plante sou diere nie kon leef nie.
mt: Plants make oxygen that people breathe in, and they take in carbon dioxide that people breathe out (that is, exhale). Plants make their own food from sunlight through photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We use plants to build our homes and to make clothes. Most of the food that we eat is plants. Without plants, animals would not be able to live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Wanneer ‘n klein groepie lewende dinge (‘n klein bevolking) van die hoofbevolking waar hulle vandaan kom, verwyder word (soos wanneer hulle oor ‘n bergreeks of ‘n rivier trek, of as hulle na ‘n nuwe eiland toe trek sodat hulle nie maklik kan terugtrek nie) sal hulle hulself baiemaal in ‘n ander omgewing vind as waarin hulle tevore was. Die nuwe omgewing het verskillende hulpbronne en ander kompetisie, dus sal die nuwe bevolking ander kenmerke of aanpassings benodig as wat hul tevore nodig gehad het om ‘n sterk mededinger te wees. Die oorspronklike bevolking het nie baie verander nie, hulle benodig steeds dieselfde aanpassings as tevore. Oor tyd, soos die nuwe bevolking begin aanpas het by hulle nuwe omgewing, het hulle minder en minder begin lyk soos die ander bevolkings. Uiteindelik, na duisende of self miljoene jare, sal die twee populasies so verskil dat hulle nie eens dieselfde spesie genoem kan word nie. Ons noem hierdie proses spesiasie, wat net die vorming van ‘n nuwe spesie beteken. Spesiasie is ‘n onvermydelike gevolg en ‘n baie belangrike deel van ewolusie.
mt: When a small group of living things (a small population) of the main population from which they came, are removed (such as when they cross over a mountain range or a river, or as they move to a new island so that they cannot easily retreat) they will find themselves in a new environment that has different resources and other competition, so the new population will need different characteristics or adaptations to be a strong competitor. The original population has not changed much, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they will look less and less like the other populations. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will be so different that they cannot even be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which only means the formation of a new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Die hooforgaan van die bloedsomloop-sisteem is die hart, wat bloed pomp. Bloed vloei weg van die hart in buise genoem are en vloei terug na die hart in buise ook genoem are. Die kleinste buisies word kapillêre are genoem.
mt: The main organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows away from the heart in vessels called arteries and flows back to the heart in vessels also called arteries. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

mt: The main organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows away from the heart in vessels called arteries and flows back to the heart in vessels also called arteries. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Insekte was die eerste diere wat gevlieg het. Hulle vermoë om te vlieg het hulle gehelp om hulle vyande makliker te vermy en kos en maats meer doeltreffend te vind. Meeste insekte het die voordeel dat hulle in staat is om hul vlerke terug op die lyf kan vou. Dit bied hulle ‘n wyer verskeidenheid klein plekkies om weg te kruip van roofdiere. Tans, is die enigste insekte wat hulle vlerke nie kan terug vou nie die naaldekokers en eendagsvlieë.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helped them evade their predators more easily and find food and mates more effectively. Most insects have the advantage that they are able to fold their wings back onto their body. This gives them a wider variety of places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings back are the cicadas and flies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Baie paleontoloë glo vandag dat een groep dinosaurusse oorleef het en vandag nog leef. Ons noem hulle voëls. Vele mense dink nie aan hulle as dinosourusse nie omdat hulle vere het en kan vlieg. Daar is baie dinge oor voëls wat steeds soos n dinosaurus lyk. Hulle het voete met skubbe en kloue, hulle lê eiers, en hulle loop op hul twee agterpote soos 'n T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists believe today that one group of dinosaurs survived and still live today. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. There are many things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Die triseratops se tande sou in dit in staat stel om nie slegs blare nie, maar ook baie ruwe takke en wortels te verbrysel. Party wetenskaplikes dink Triseratopse het broodbome geëet, wat ‘n tipe plant was wat algemeen was tydens die Krytperiode. Hierdie plante lyk soos ‘n klein palmboom met ‘n kroon skerp, stekelrige blare. Die Trikeratops kon sy sterk snawel gebruik het om die blare af te stroop voordat dit die stomp gevreet het. Ander wetenskaplikes argumenteer dat hierdie plante baie giftig is, so dit is onwaarskynlik dat enige dinosourus dit geëet het, selfs al kan diere soos die luidier en ander diere soos die papegaai (‘n afstammeling van die dinosourusse) vandag giftige blare of vrugte kan eet.
mt: The triceratops’ teeth would have allowed it to not only break off leaves, but also very rough twigs and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate bread trees, a type of plant that was common during the Cretaceous period. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, thorny leaves. The Triceratops could have used its strong snout to strip the leaves before it bit off the stump. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even if animals such as the rhinoceros and other animals such as the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can today eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Italië se nasionale sokker span, saam met die Duitse nasionale sokkerspan is die tweede mees suksesvolle span in die wêreld en was die FIFA Wêreld Beker wenners in 2006. Gewilde sporte sluit voetbal, basketbal, vlugbal, waterpolo, skerm, rugby, fietsry, yshokkie, rolskaatshokkie en F1 moterrenjaery in. Wintersport is meer gewild in die Noordelike streke, met Italianers wat in Internasionale spele en Olimpiese byeenkomste deelneem.
mt: Italy's national soccer team, along with the German national soccer team, is the second most successful team in the world and was the FIFA World Cup winners in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and Formula One motor racing. Winter sports are more popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxemburg het 'n lang geskiedenis, maar die land se onafhanklikheid dateer vanaf 1839. Huidige dele van België was deel van Luxembourg in die verlede, maar het Belgies geword na die Belgiese Revolusie in die 1830s. Luxemburg het altyd probeer om ‘n neutrale land te bly, maar dis beset in beide Wêreld Oorlog I en Wêreld Oorlog II deur Duitsland. In 1957 het Luxembourg die stigterslid van die organisasie geword wat ons vandag ken as die Europese Unie.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but the country's independence dates from 1839. Current parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past, but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country, but was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957, Luxembourg became the founding member of the organization that we know today as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Europese Turkye (oostelike Thracië of Rumelië in die Balkanse skiereiland) sluit 3% van die land in. Die gebied in Turkye is meer as 1,600 kilometers (1,000 mi) lank en 800 km (500 mi) wyd, met ‘n rofweg reghoekige vorm. Turkye se are, insluitend mere, omhels 783 562 vierkante kilometer (300 948 vk myl), waarvan 755 688 vk kilometer (291 773 vk myl) in die suidweste van Asië en 23 764 vk km (9 174vk myl) in Europa geleë is. Turkye se are maak dit die wêreld se 37e grootste land, en dit is omtrent die grootte van Metropolitaanse Frankryk en die Verenigde Koninkryk saam. Turkye word op drie kante deur seë omring: Die Egeïese See aan die westekant, die Swart See aan die noordekant en die Mediterreense See aan die suidekant.
mt: 3% of the country is in European Turkey (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). The area in Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometers (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's areas, including lakes, cover 783 562 square kilometers (300 948 sq mi), of which 755 688 sq km (291 773 sq mi) are in southwestern Asia and 23 764 sq km (9 174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's areas make it the world's 37th largest country, and it is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is surrounded by seas on three sides: The Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Die Vatikaanstad se bevolking is ongeveer 800. Dis die kleinste onafhanklike land in die wêreld en die land met die laagste bevolking. Vatikaan Stad gebruik Italiaans in sy wetgewing en amptelike kommunikasie. Italiaans is ook die daaglikse taal deur vele gebruik wat in state werk waar Latyns gereeld in godsdienstige seremonies gebruik word. Alle burgers van die Vatikaan Stad is Rooms Katoliek.
mt: The population of Vatican City is about 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communication. Italian is also the daily language by many who work in states where Latin is used regularly in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Die Vatikaanstad se bevolking is ongeveer 800. Dis die kleinste onafhanklike land in die wêreld en die land met die laagste bevolking. Vatikaan Stad gebruik Italiaans in sy wetgewing en amptelike kommunikasie. Italiaans is ook die daaglikse taal deur vele gebruik wat in state werk waar Latyns gereeld in godsdienstige seremonies gebruik word. Alle burgers van die Vatikaan Stad is Rooms Katoliek.
mt: The population of Vatican City is about 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communication. Italian is also the daily language by many who work in states where Latin is used regularly in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Rekenaars vandag word gebruik om fotos en videos te manipuleer. Gesofistikeerde diere kan gekonstrueer word op rekenaars, en hierdie tipe animasie word toenemend in televisie en films gebruik. Musiek word meestal opgeneem deur die gebruik van gesofistikeerde rekenaars om die klanke te prosesseer en saam te meng.
mt: Computers today are used to manipulate photos and videos. Sophisticated animals can be constructed on computers, and this type of animation is increasingly used in television and films. Music is usually recorded by using sophisticated computers to process and mix the sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Die stede Harappa en Mohenjo-dara het ‘n spoeltoilet in amper elke huis gehad, en dit was geheg aan ‘n gesofistikeerde rioolsisteem. Oorblyfsels van dreinsisteme is gevind in huise van die Minoïese stede Krete en Santorini in Griekeland. Daar was ook toilette in antieke Egipte, Persië en China. In Romeinse beskawing, was toilette soms deel van publieke badhuise waar mans en vrouens saam in gemengde geselskap was.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in nearly every house, and it was attached to a sophisticated sewer system. Remains of drain systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bathhouses where men and women were together in mixed company.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: n Lem van 'n moderne ysskaatsskoen het 'n dubbele rant met 'n holronde tussen-in. Die twee rante laat toe vir 'n beter greep op die ys, selfs wanneer dit gekantel word. Omdat die onderkant van die lem ligweg ‘n kurwe het, soos die lem van een kant na die ander kantel, kry die kant van die ys in kontak met die lem ook kurwes. Dit stel die skaatser in staat om te draai. Indien die skaats na regs kantel, draai die skaatser regs, indien die skaatse na links kantel, draai die skaatser links.
mt: The tip of a modern ice skate blade has a double curve with a hollow between them. The two curves allow for a better grip on the ice, even when it is tilted. Because the underside of the blade is slightly curved, like the blade of one side tilting towards the other side, the side of the ice in contact with the blade also curves. This allows the skater to turn. If the skate tilts to the right, the skater turns right, if the skate tilts to the left, the skater turns left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Om na hulle vorige energievlak terug te keer, moet hulle ontslae raak van die ekstra energie wat hulle van die lig af gekry het. Hulle doen dit deur ‘n klein deeltjie lig,’ ‘n “foton genoem”, af te gee. Wetenskaplikes noem hierdie proses “gestimuleerde emissie van bestraling” omdat die atome gestimuleer word deur die helder lig, wat die vrystelling van n foton van lig veroorsaak, en lig is n tipe van bestraling. Die volgende prent toon die atome wat protone afgee. Natuurlik is protone in die regte lewe baie kleiner as in die prent. Fotone is selfs kleiner as die goed waaruit atome bestaan!
mt: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by giving off a tiny particle of light, called a “photon.” Scientists call this process “stimulated emission of radiation” because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, which causes the release of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms giving off protons. Of course, protons in real life are much smaller than the objects shown in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the things atoms are made of!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Na honderde ure se gebruik brand die filament in die gloeilamp uiteindelik uit en die gloeilamp werk nie meer nie. Die gloeilamp moet dan vervang word. Dit is nodig om versigtig te wees wanneer die gloeilamp vervang word. Eerstens moet die skakelaar vir die armatuur afgeskakel word of die kabel ontkoppel word. Dit is omdat elektrisiteit wat in die prop waar die metaal gedeelte van die gloeilamp sit vloei jou ‘n ernstige elektriese skok kan gee as jy die binnekant van die prop of die metaalbasis van die gloeilamp aanraak terwyl dit steeds gedeeltelik in die prop is.
mt: After hundreds of hours of use, the filament in the light bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb must then be replaced. It is necessary to be careful when replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the fixture must be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity that flows in the base where the metal part of the light bulb sits can give you a serious electrical shock if you touch the inside of the base or the metal base of the light bulb while it is still partially in the base.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: n Fissie bom werk op die beginsel dat dit energie neem om 'n nukleus met baie protone en neutrone saam te stel. Dis amper soos om ‘n swaar wa by ‘n heuwel op te stoot. Die splitsing van ‘n nukleus stel van daardie energie vry. Sommige atome het onstabiele kerns wat beteken dat hulle uitmekaar breek met bietjie of geen aansporing.
mt: A fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to assemble a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. It’s almost like trying to push a heavy car up a hill. The splitting of a nucleus releases that energy. Some atoms have unstable cores that means they break apart with a little or no prompting.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Wanneer jy iemand bel wat duisende myle ver is, gebruik jy ‘n satelliet. Die satelliet in die ruimte ontvang die oproep en reflekteer dit terug, byna onmiddelik. Die satelliet is in die ruimte in gestuur deur ‘n vuurpyl. Wetenskaplikes gebruik teleskope in die ruimte omdat die Aarde se atmosfeer van ons lig en sig verwring. Dit vat ‘n reuse vuurpyl van oor ‘n 100 voet hoog om ‘n sateliet of teleskoop in die buitenste ruim te sit.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite in space receives the call and reflects it back, almost immediately. The satellite was put into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts our light and sight. It takes a huge rocket over 100 feet tall to put a satellite or telescope into outer space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Tyd is iets wat reg rondom ons is, en alles wat ons doen beïnvloed, al is dit moeilik om te verstaan. Tyd word al duisende jare bestudeer deur godsdienstige, filosofiese en wetenskaplike kenners. Ons ervaar tyd as ‘n reeks van gebeurtenisse wat vanaf die toekoms deur die huidige na die verlede deurgaan. Tyd is hoe ons die duur (lengte) van gebeure vergelyk. Jy kan die verloop van tyd self merk deur die repetisie van 'n sikliese gebeurtenis te aanskou. 'n Sikliese gebeurtenis is iets wat gereeld oor en oor gebeur.
mt: Time is something that is around us all the time, and everything we do is influenced by it, even though it is difficult to understand. Time has been studied for thousands of years by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars. We experience time as a series of events that go from the future through the present to the past. Time is how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passage of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclic event. A cyclic event is something that happens over and over again.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Tradisioneel sou die erfgenaam van die troon reguit na die weermag gegaan het nadat die skool-loopbaan voltooi is. Charles het egter universiteit op Trinity Kollege, Cambridge, geloop waar hy Antropologie en Argeologie, en later Geskiedenis bestudeer het, en ‘n 2:2 (‘n laer tweede klas graad) verwerf het. Charles was die eerste lid van die Britse koninklike familie om ‘n graad toegeken te he.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would have gone straight into the military after completing school. Charles, however, went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge, where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, and received a 2:2 (a lower second class degree) in the process. Charles was the first member of the British royal family to receive a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Engeland het 'n lang periode van vrede ervaar na die herowering van die Danelaw. Nietemin is Ethelred in 991 deur 'n Viking vloot groter as enige weermag, sedert Guthrum s'n 'n eeu tevore, in die gesig gestaar. Die vloot was deur Olaf Trygvasson, ‘n Norweër met ambisie om sy land van Deense dominasie terug te eis, gely. Na aanvanklike militêre terugslae, was Ethelred in staat om ooreen te kom op bepalings met Olaf, wat homself tot Noorweë gewend het om sy koninkryk te verkry - met gemengde sukses.
mt: England had experienced a long period of peace after the re-conquest of the Danelaw. Nevertheless, Ethelred was confronted in 991 by a Viking fleet larger than any army, since Guthrum's a century earlier, in the face. The fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his land from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree on terms with Olaf, who had turned to Norway to obtain his kingdom - with mixed success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Rondom die 15de eeu was noordelike Estonië onder groot kulturele invloed van Duitsland. Sommige Duitse monnike wou God nader bring aan die plaaslike mense, so hulle het die Estoniaanse letterlike taal geskep. Dit was op die Duitse alfabet gebasseer en een karakter ""Õ/õ"" was bygevoeg. Soos die tyd berby gegaan het, is baie woorde wat aan Duits verbonde is geleen. Dit was die begin van inligting."
mt: " Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local people, so they created the Estonian phonetic language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time went by, many words that were related to German were borrowed. This was the beginning of information."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Daar is verkeie skattings van hoeveel mense Hindi praat. Dit is geskat dat dit tussen die tweede en vierde mees algemene’ gesproke taal ter wêreld is. Die getal moedertaal sprekers verander afhangende van hoe naby verwante dialekte ingereken word. Beraminge strek van 340 miljoen tot 500 miljoen sprekers, en soveel as 800 miljoen mense kan die taal verstaan. Hindi en Urdu is eners in taalgebruik maar verskillend in skryf; in daaglike geselskappe kan sprekers van beide tale normaalweg mekaar verstaan.
mt: There are various estimates of how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on how closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are one in spoken usage but different in writing; in daily conversation speakers of both languages can normally understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangeul is die enigste doelgerigte alfabet in die daaglikse gebruik. Die alfabet is in 1444 uitgevind tydens die regering van koning Sejong (1418 - 1450). Koning Sejong was die vierde koning van die Joseon Dinastie en was een van die wat die hoogste geag is. Hy het oorspronklik die Hangeul alfabet Hunmin Jeongeum genoem, wat beteken “die korrekte klanke vir die onderrig van die mense”.
mt: Hangeul is the only purpose-built alphabet in daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 - 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and was one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Daar is baie teorieë oor hoe Sanskrit in bestaan geroep is. Een hiervan is oor ‘n Ariese migrasie uit die weste na Indië wat hul taal met hulle saamgebring het. Sanskrit is 'n antieke taal en is ooreenkomstig met die Latynse taal wat in Europa gepraat word. Die vroegste bekende boek in die wêreld is in Sanskrit geskryf. Na die samestelling van die Upanishads, het Sanskrit verbleik vanweë die hiërargieë. Sanskrit is 'n baie komplekse en ryk taal wat as bron vir vele moderne Indiese tale gedien het, nes Latyn die bron vir Europese tale soos Frans en Spaans is.
mt: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came to be. One of these is about an Aryan migration from the west to India that brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is accordingly with the Latin language that is spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world is written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of the Upanishads, Sanskrit faded away due to the hierarchies. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language that served as a source for many modern Indian languages, as Latin was the source for European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Hoe sou Io se swaartekrag op my inwerk? Indien jy op die oppervlak van Io sou staan, sou jy minder weeg as wat jy op Aarde weeg. ‘n Persoon wat om en by 200 pond (90kg) op Aarde weeg, sou 36 pond (16kg) op Io weeg. So die swaartekrag trek dus minder aan jou.
mt: How would Io’s gravity affect me? If you were standing on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs about 200 pounds (90 kilograms) on Earth would weigh 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on Io. So the gravity pulls less on you.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Die oppervlakte van die Maan is gemaak uit klippe en stof. Die buitenste laag van die Maan word die kors genoem. Die kors is ongeveer 70km dik aan die naaste kant en 100 km dik aan die ver kant. Dit is dunner onder die oseane en dikker onder die hooglande. Daar mag dalk meer maria aan die naaste kant wees want die kors is dunner. Dit was makliker vir lawa om na die oppervlak te styg.
mt: The surface of the Moon is made up of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick at the nearest side and 100 km thick at the far side. It is thinner under the oceans and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria at the nearest side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Vele mense droom van die dag wanneer die mensdom na ‘n ander ster kan reis en ander wêrelde kan verken. Sommige mense wonder wat is daar buite en sommiges glo dat daar ruimte vreemdeling of ander lewe is op ‘n ander planeet. Maar, as hierdie ooit gebeur, moontlik sal dit nie vir ‘n baie lang tyd gebeur nie. Die sterre is so uitgespry dat daar triljoene myle tussen sterre is wat “bure” is. Dalk sal jou agter kleinkinders eendag op ‘n uitheemse wêreld staan en wonder oor hul antieke voorouers?
mt: Many people dream of the day when mankind can travel to another star and explore other worlds. Some people wonder what is out there and some believe that there are aliens or other life on another planet. But if this ever happens, it may not happen for a very long time. The stars are so far apart that there are trillions of miles between stars that are “neighbors”. Perhaps your great-great-grandchildren will one day stand on an alien world and wonder about their ancient ancestors?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Die Son het nie ‘n kors soos die aarde waarop jy kan staan nie. Die hele Son bestaan uit gasse, vuur en plasma. Die gas word dunner hoe verder jy van die middelpunt van die son af beweeg.. Die buitenste deel wat ons sien wanneer ons kyk na die Son word die fotosfeer genoem, wat ""bal van lig"" beteken."
mt: "The Sun does not have a crust like the earth on which you can stand. The whole Sun consists of gases, fire and plasma. The gas becomes thinner the further you move away from the center of the Sun. The outer part that we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Ongeveer drieduisend jaar later, in 1610, het ‘n Italiaanse astronoom Galileo Galilei ‘n teleskoop gebruik om op te merk dat Venus fases het, nes die maan. Fases onstaan want slegs die kant van Venus (of van die Maan) wat na die Son wys is verlig. Die fases van Venus het die teorie van Copernicus ondersteun dat die planete om die Son wentel. Toe, ‘n paar jaar later, in 1639 het ‘n Engelse astronoom met die naam Jeremia Horrocks ‘n oordrag van Venus observeer.
mt: About 3,000 years later, in 1610, an Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to note that Venus had phases, like the moon. Phases arise because only the side of Venus (or the Moon) that faces the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets orbit the Sun. Then, a few years later, in 1639 an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Die Amasoon Rivier is die tweede langste en die grootste rivier op Aarde. Dit dra meer as 8 keer meer water as die tweede grootste rivier. Die Amasone is ook die wydste rivier op Aarde, by tye ses myl wyd. ‘n Volle 20 persent van die water wat uit die planeet se riviere in oseane in vloei, kom uit die Amasone. Die hoofrivier van die Amasone Rivier is 6,387 km (3,980 myl). Dit versamel water uit duisende kleiner riviere.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and the largest river on Earth. It carries more than eight times more water than the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that flows out of the planet’s rivers into oceans flows out of the Amazon. The main river of the Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Agtien persent van Venezolane is werkloos, en meeste wat werk word in die informele ekonomie in diens geneem. Twee derdes van Venezolane wat werk, werk in die dienstesektor, byna ‘n derde werk die bedryfsektor en ‘n vyfde werk in landbou. ‘n Belangrike bedryf vir Venesolane is olie, waar die land ‘n netto-uitvoerder is, selfs al werk slegs een persent in die oliebedryf.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most who work are employed in the informal economy. Two-thirds of Venezuelans who work, work in the service sector, nearly a third work in the industrial sector and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Sterre gee lig en hitte af as gevolg van die energie waarmee hydrogen atome saamsmelt (of byeenkom) om swaarder elemente te vorm. Wetenskaplikes werk om 'n reaktor te skep wat energie op dieselfde manier opwek. Dit het, nietemin, ‘n baie moeilike probleem geraak om op te los en sal baie jare neem voor ons bruikbare fusie reaktors gebou sien.
mt: Stars shine and give off heat as a result of the energy released when hydrogen atoms fuse (or come together) to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that generates energy in the same way. It has, however, run into a very difficult problem to solve and will take many years before we see usable fusion reactors built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elemente en samestellings kan van een toestand na ‘n ander oorgaan en nie verander nie. Stikstof as ‘n gas het dieselfde eienskappe as vloeibare stikstof. Die vloeistof staat is digter, maar die molekules is steeds dieselfde. Water is ‘n ander voorbeeld. Die saamgestelde water is opgemaak uit twee hydrogen atome en een suurstof atom. Dit het dieselfde molekulêre struktuur of dit nou ‘n gas, vloeistof of vastestof is. Al verander die fisiese toestand bly die chemiese toestand dieselfde.
mt: Elements and compounds can change from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid is denser, but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. All the physical state changes the chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Gedurende die Revolutionêre Oorlog, het die dertien state ‘n swak sentrale regering gevorm – met die Kongres as sy enigste komponent – onder die Artikels van Konfederasie. Die kongres het nie die mag gehad om belasting af te dwing nie, en, omdat daar geen nasionale uitvoerder of regbank was nie, het hulle op die staats-owerhede, wat gereeld nie wou saamwerk nie, staatgemaak om all hulle aktes uit te voer. Dit het ook geen outoriteit gehad om belastingwette en tariewe tussen state te oorskry nie. Die Artikels vereis eenparige toestemming van alle state voordat hul verander kan word and state neem die sentrale regering so ligtelik dat hul verteenwoordigers gereeld afwesig was.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states formed a weak central government – with the Congress as its only component – under the Articles of Confederation. The Congress did not have the power to tax, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, they relied on the state governments, which frequently refused to cooperate, to carry out all their acts. It also had no authority to tax laws and rates between states. The Articles require unanimous consent of all states before they can be changed and states take the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: AS jy die film National Treasure gesien het, mag jy dink dat daar 'n skatkaart agterop die Verklaring van Onafhanklikheid geskryf is. Nietemin is dit nie waar nie. Al is daar iets wat op die rugkant van die dokument geskryf staan, is dit nie ‘n skatkaart nie. Gekrewe agterop die Verklaring van Onafhaklikheid was die woorde “Oorspronklike Verklaring van Onafhanklikheid gedateer 4de Julie 1776”. Die teks verskyn onderstebo, onderaan die dokument. Terwyl niemand verseker weet wie dit geskryf het nie, is dit bekend dat vroeg in sy lewe, die groot parkement dokument (dit meet 29¾ duim by 24½ duim) vir storing opgerol is. So, dit is moontlik dat die notasie eenvoudig bygevoeg is as ‘n etiket.
mt: If you have seen the movie National Treasure, you may think that there is a treasure map written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, this is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Creased on the back of the Declaration of Independence was the words “Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776”. The text appears upside down, at the bottom of the document. While no one is sure who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is possible that the annotation was simply added as a label.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Die Singapore Botanic Garden se kennis het vroeg in die nasie se onafhanlikheid gehelp om die eiland te verander na ‘n tropiese Tuin Stad. In 1981, is Vanda Miss Joaquim, ‘n orgidee hibried, gekies as die nasie se nasionale blom.
mt: The Singapore Botanic Garden’s knowledge helped early in the nation’s independence to change the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation’s national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Al het piramiede-bou in steen voort geduur tot die einde van die Ou Koninkryk, is die piramides van Giza nooit in grootte en tegniese uitnemendheid van konstruksie oortref nie. Nuwe Koninkryk antieke Egiptenare is verstom deur hul voorgangers se monumente, wat toe goed oor die duisend jaar oud was.
mt: Although pyramid building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in size and constructional excellence by the monuments of the ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom. New Kingdom Egyptians were awed by their predecessors' monuments, which were then well over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Elke jaar om en by Oktober reis nastenby 1.5 miljoen herbivore na die suiderlike vlaktes, en oorkruis hulle die Mara Rivier van die noordelike heuwels se kant af vir die reën. En dan terug Noorde toe deur die weste, weer oor die Mara rivier, na die reën in April. Die Serengeti streek sluit die Serengeti Nasionale Park in, die Ngorongoro Bewaringsgebied en Maswa Wildreservaat in Tanzania en die Maasai Mara Nasionale Reservaat in Kenia.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores migrate south to the southern plains every October, and cross the Mara River from the northern hills to the rain. And then back north through the west, again over the Mara river, to the rain in April. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "Met die einde van die oorlog om Frankryk, het Duitsland homself begin gereed maak om die eiland van Brittanje in te val. Duitsland het die aanval die kode-naam “Operation Sealion” gegee. Die Britse weermag het meeste van sy swaar wapens en voorrade verloor toe hy van Dunkirk ontrek het, en was daarom redelik swak. Maar die Koninklike Vloot is steeds veel sterker as die Duitse Vloot (""Kriegsmarine"") en kon enige invallende vloot wat oor die Engelse kanaal gestuur is, vernietig. Nietemin is baie min Koninklike Vlootskepe naby die mees waarskynlike invalsroetes gestasioneer aangesien die admirale bang was dat hulle deur 'n Duitse lugaanval gesink sou word."
mt: " With the end of the war in France, Germany began to prepare itself to invade the island of Britain. Germany gave the attack the code-name “Operation Sealion”. The British army had lost most of its heavy weapons and supplies when it retreated from Dunkirk, and was therefore relatively weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could destroy any invading fleet that was sent across the English Channel. Nevertheless, very few Royal Navy ships were stationed near the most likely invasion routes because the admirals were afraid that they would be sunk by a German air attack."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Kom ons begin met ‘n verduideliking oor Italië se planne. Italië was hoofsaaklik die “klein boetie” van Duitsland en Japan. Hulle het ‘n swakker weermag en ‘n swakker vloot gehad, alhoewel hulle vier nuwe skepe gebou het net voor die oorlog begin het. Italië se hoof doel was Afrika lande. Om hierdie lande gevange te neem, sou hulle lanseerplatform vir troepe benodig, sodat troepe oor die Middelandse See kon seil en Afrika binneval. Hiervoor moes hulle ontslae raak van Britse basisse en skepe in Egipte. Behalwe hiervoor, was Italië se gevegskepe nie veronderstel om enigiets anders te doen nie. Nou vir Japan. Japan was ‘n eiland, nes Britanje.
mt: Let’s start with an explanation of Italy’s plans. Italy was mainly the “little brother” of Germany and Japan. They had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they built four new ships just before the war began. Italy’s main goal was to capture African countries. To do this, they would need a launch platform for troops, so that troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For this, they would need to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides this, Italy’s warships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island, like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: Die D-Dag landings en die stryde wat vervolgens uitgebreek het, het die noorde van Frankryk vry gemaak, maar steeds was die Suide nie vry nie. Dit was deur die “Vichy” Franse beheer. Hulle was Franse mense wat met die Duitsers vrede gemaak het in 1940 en saam met die indringers gewerk het in plaas daarvan om met hulle te bakei. Op die 15e Autustus 1940 het die Geallieerdes Suid-Frankryk binnegeval, die inval het bekend gestaan as “Operasie Dragoon”. In net twee weke het die Amerikaners en die Franse magte die suide van Frankryk bevry en hulle tot Duitsland gewend.
mt: The D-Day landings and the battles that followed freed the north of France, but the south was still not free. It was controlled by the “Vichy” French, who were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allied forces invaded southern France, the invasion was known as “Operation Dragoon”. In just two weeks, the Americans and French forces freed the south of France and turned towards Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."
